loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
María, tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y una hija que tiene 3 años de edad, ella administra una granja de cerdos de engorde, tiene tres años de estar en ella, trabaja a tiempo completo al mismo tiempo que las atenciones para su hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 4 cerdos, para añadirlos a la granja, esta inversión le ayudara para incrementar el negocio y que sus ingresos sean mejores a futuro, ya que sus ventas según la disponibilidad de cerdos así es de favorable.
La aspiración de María es que esta granja la pueda mantener a largo tiempo, tambien que su familia cuente con su apoyo y mejorar cada día para ofrecerle una mejor condición.
texts.en:
María is 24 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter, who is 3 years old. She manages a pig farm. She has been doing this for three years. She works full time in addition to running her household.

She is asking for a loan to buy 4 pigs, to add them to the farm. This investment will help her grow her business and improve her income in the future, since her sales depend on the availability of pigs, so it's beneficial.

Maia aspires to having this farm support her long term, also for her family to have her support and to improve every day to be able to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four pigs for the farm.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
José, tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de fibra de henequén, se dedica  a tiempo completo, desde hace 30 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la reparacion de un motor de 8 HP para desfibrar y además sembrara más henequén, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para José, pues le permitirá tener las herramientas necesarias para la realización del trabajo.
La aspiración de José es realizar un buen trabajo, mejorando cada día su productividad para poder mejorar tambien las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He makes a living producing hemp fiber. He has worked full time in this activity, which he learned from his father, for the last 30 years.

At present he is requesting this loan in order to repair an 8 HP motor for shredding and he will also plant more hemp. This loan will be a great help to José as it will allow him to get the necessary tools to do the job.

José goal is to do good work, improving his daily productivity to be able to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair a hemp shredding motor.

loans.name: Santos Gabriela

texts.es: Santos Gabriela es una emprendedoras que ha luchado por seguir sus sueño de tener su propio negocio con el apoyo de  su hijo iniciaron este negocio, también porque necesitaban generar ingresos a la familia. Ella ya es clienta de la Fundación León 2000, en el cual es una persona perseverante y ganas de superación, con el prestamos anterior invirtió en el negocio de las ventas de botellas. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar gallina, cuajadas y envases de vidrio entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Santos Gabriela is an entrepreneurial woman who has fought for her dream of having her own business. With the support of her son, they set up this business, as they needed to generate income for the family. She is already a client of Fundación León 2000, in which she is persistent and always tries to exceed herself. 

With her previous loan she invested in her bottle selling business. This time she is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens, cuajada (curds) and glass containers, amongst other products.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cuajada and glass containers, amongst other products.

loans.name: Solidarité Plus Group

texts.en:
Françoise is the leader of the Community Bank named “Solidarité Plus.” It consists of 28 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Françoise has been a micro-entrepreneur for years. She runs a general store to the east of Kinshasa. She works hard with good management skills in order to achieve her goal of one day opening a large store in her area. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her US$ 600 per month. 

Françoise is a trustworthy client of MFI HOPE RDC, having nine times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying the items needed by her customers and reselling them at profit. 56 years old, Françoise is married and the mother of six children, whose ages vary between 4 and 18 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase her store’s stock by buying more items needed by her     customers.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bon Coeur Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of the Community Bank named “Bon Coeur Plus". It is composed of 26 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Marie is 58 years old and divorced. She is a mother of five children aged between 31 and 44 years old. She sells miscellaneous goods. She has been active in her business since 2001. She began her business selling miscellaneous goods. She joined a group of Hope (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in order to achieve her dream of one day developing an orchard of fruit trees and a field of manioc.

loans.use: to buy her goods in larger quantities.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es: Fernando es una emprendedor exitoso que tiene experiencia en brindar el servicio de carpintería él es cliente de Fundación León 2000, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar capital trabajo aumentando sus clientes ya que le realizaban pedido. Fernando es muy visitado por sus clientes por la calidad de servicio que brinda. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar herramienta de trabajo, Madera, clavos entre otras cosas
texts.en:
Fernando is a successful entrepreneur who has experience in offering a carpentry service. He is a client of Fundación León 2000. He used his previous loan to buy work capital which increased his client base as he works on demand. Fernando is very solicited by his clients due to the quality of the service he offers. 

This time he is requesting the loan to buy work tools, wood and nails, among other items.

loans.use: to buy work tools, wood, nails, among other items.

loans.name: Manuel Armando

texts.es:
Manuel Armando, tiene 30 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos con edades entre 4 a 17 años de edad, el tuvo sus hijos desde muy joven, vive en Cofradia, Cortes. Su esposa se dedica al comercio.
Manuel, estudio técnico en computación y para ejercer su profesión estableció su propio negocio de un Cibernet hace 6 meses. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila. Inicio este negocio con fondos propios, le dedica 12 horas diarias. Actualmente es su primer préstamo y lo va invertir en el negocio en compra de accesorios para reparación y mantenimiento de las computadoras. Su plan es crecer en clientes brindando un buen servicio, para tener más solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Manuel Armando, age 30, is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 17.  He had his children when he was very young.  He lives in Cofradia, Cortes.  His wife is a businesswoman.

Manuel studied to be a computer technician, and in order to practice his profession he established his own business, a cybernet café, six months ago.  He previously worked in a factory.  He started this business with his own funds.  He works 12 hours a day.

This is his first loan.  He will use it invest in his business by purchasing repair and maintenance accessories for computers.  His plan is to get more customers by providing good service and to be more financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy repair and maintenance accessories for computers in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Sanza Plus Group

texts.en:
Antoinette is the leader of this community bank named “Sanza Plus,” which means moon in English. It is made up of 16 members firmly united to receive loans from the microfinance institution HOPE RDC to develop their businesses. Antoinette is 49 years old and is married with two children, ages 8 and 11. Both of her children attend school.

Antoinette’s main business is selling slippers and women’s clothing in a market located in the mid-west of Kinshasa. She has been doing this for a long time and has acquired solid experience in this area. Antoinette works hard and has good management skills, and she hopes to achieve her dream of one day opening a clothing shop. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which currently provides her with about 280 USD each month. Antoinette works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. 

Antoinette is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC and has obtained and successfully repaid seven previous loans. She will use her loan to buy more pairs of slippers in bulk to resell at a profit.

loans.use: to buy slippers in bulk to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.en:
July is a leader of a community bank named “Soleil Plus,” which is composed of 11 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

July is 57 years old and the father of six children between 7 and 21 years old. Four of his children go to school. Since 2000, July sells miscellaneous products at a market located to the east of Kinshasa. He currently earns 400 USD each month. After learning about Hope's loan program from a friend, he decided to join one of its groups in late 2009. July has already received ten loans from Hope that he has successfully repaid. 

July is requesting a loan to increase the inventory of his goods to generate additional profit. His ambition is to be a large retail provider in his area.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María, originaria de la Ceiba un pequeña comarca localizada en las afueras de Leo tiene 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos , lleva 5 años trabajando en esta actividad. Inicio esta actividad cuando tenia 25 años de edad, pues este negocio lo aprendió por tradición de su familia quien se dedicaba a lo mismo. Ella realizo el crédito para compra de cerdos de desarrollo y compra de concentrado para alimentarlos.
Uno de sus sueños es tener una grana de cerdos reproductores para mejorar sus ventas y poder tener ganancias que le permitan mejorar su vivienda ofrecerle un techo digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is originally from La Ceiba, a small region situated on the outskirts of Leon. She has two children. She is a merchant, and she makes a living raising pigs. She has worked in this activity for the past five years. She set up this business when she was 25 years old. She learned this business as a family tradition, as they worked in the same. 

She requests this loan to buy fattening pigs and concentrated feed for them. One of her dreams is to have a pig breeding farm in order to improve her sales and be able to have earning which would allow her to improve her home and offer her children a decent roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy fattening pigs and concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María, habita en Quezalguaque municipio de León, madre de dos hijos,es ama de casa y comerciante, de dedica de lleno a  la crianza de cerdos los cuales vende en su comunidad. Ella inicio con este negocio a los 28 años de edad, anteriormente vendía granos básicos pero ahora trabaja junto con su esposo en la crianza y venta de estos animales. 
Ella realizo el crédito para la compra de cerdos, insumos para mantener la salud y alimentación de sus animales. Entre sus expectativas esta ampliar la producción de cerdos de raza, mejorar su casita que esta muy deteriorada y seguir luchando por mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, inhabitant of Quezalguaque in the municipality of León, is the mother of two children. She is both a housewife and a merchant. She makes a living raising pigs which she sells in the community. She started this business when she was 28 years old. Previously she sold staple grains but now she works together with her husband in the raising and selling of these animals.

She requests this loan to buy pigs and supplies to care for and feed her animals. Her hopes are to extend the production of breeding pigs, improve her home which is very run down and continue struggling to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, and other items

loans.name: Santos Ernesto

texts.es:
Santos, de 34 años de edad, casado,tiene 2 hijos, de oficio agricultor, su educación es básica solo finalizo el sexto grado de la primaria, vive en la comunidad El  Coyolito localizado en Jinotega. Inicialmente comenzó trabajando con su hermano y su papa entre los tres unieron capital para sembrar pero hace dos años se independizo de ellos y ahora trabaja por su cuenta. El viaja hasta el mercado local de la ciudad de Estelí para vender chiltomas, cebollas, tomates que le mismo siembra. 
El solicito el crédito para sembrar chiltoma y cebolla. Pues el crédito le ayudara a compara insumos y pagar mano de obra que necesita para establecer su cosecha de la cual espera le produzca hortalizas de muy buena calidad. Aunque el terreno en el que siembra lo alquila el no pierde la esperanza de tener sus propias áreas de siembra para generar empleos en su comunidad y salir adelante para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos, age 34, is married and has two children.  He is a farmer by trade, and he has an elementary school education as he only finished the sixth grade.  He lives in the El Coyolito community in Jinotega.

At first he started working with his brother and his father.  The three of them put their money together in order to plant.  Two years ago he became independent of them, and he now works on his own.  He travels to the local market in the city of Estelí in order to sell the bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes that he grows.

He requested the loan to plant bell peppers and onions.  The loan will help him buy supplies and to pay for the labor that he needs for his harvest.  He hopes that the harvest produces very good quality vegetables.

Even though he rents the land where he plants, he does not lose the hope of having his own land to farm.  This would generate employment in his community, and he would get ahead in order to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to plant bell peppers and onions.

loans.name: Silvia Sara

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia es socia del banco comunal 2671, vive por un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

Doña Silvia tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo tiene una discapacidad por lo que recibe estimulación y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios conduciendo una unidad de taxis, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora Silvia se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal desde hace 6 años y labora sin un horario fijo, muchas veces sus clientes la visitan en su casa para que les venda sus productos.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para incrementar su mercadería.
 
Su sueño es que su hijo se mantenga con buena salud.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of Communal Bank 2671.  She lives is a pretty place in the city of Cuenca, one of the most important cities in the country.  In December 1999 it was named a World Heritage Site.  The people there maintain the culture and traditions of their communities, and they are known for being pleasant and kind people.

Silvia, 36, is married and has three children from this relationship, ages 13, 10, and 1.  Her first son has a disability for which she receives assistance and her second daughter studies in a school in the city.  Her husband is a driver by profession and offers services driving a taxi.  She does not have her own home, which is why she lives in her mother's home and shares the household expenses.

Silvia has worked for six years selling Yanbal beauty products and she works without a fixed schedule.  Many times her customers visit her in her home so she can sell them products.

This is the fifth loan she is getting from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying cosmetics to increase her merchandise.

Her dream is for her son to stay in good health.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Gladys Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys es socia del banco comunal 2671, vive por un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

La Señora. Gladys tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller propio en donde fabrica muebles, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Gladys labora en un almacén donde vende los muebles que su esposo fabrica y se encuentra 10 años en este negocio.  También vende Toperware (plástico) encontrándose en esta actividad 2 años.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de artículos de Toperware para su negocio y madera para el negocio de su marido.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of Communal Bank 2671.  She lives in a pretty part of the city of Cuenca, one of the most important cities in the country.  In December 1999 it was named a World Heritage Site.  The people there maintain the culture and traditions of their communities and are known for being pleasant and kind people.

Gladys, 30, is married and has two children from this relationship, ages 12 and 8.  Her oldest child studies in secondary school and her second, a daughter, studies in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband has his own workshop where he makes furniture.  She does not have her own home, so she rents.

Gladys works in a department store when she sells the furniture her husband makes, and she has been in this business for ten years.  She also has been selling Tupperware (plastic) for two years.

She is in her third loan from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying plastic Tupperware products for her business and wood for her husband's business.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy plastic Tupperware products and wood.

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal 2671, vive por un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

La Señora. María tiene 35 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad que  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal y Avon y esta actividad la realiza hace 10 años, también vende ropa por catalogo  hace 3 meses.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos.
 
Su meta es comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
María is a member of Communal Bank 2671.  She lives in a pretty place in the city of Cuenca, one of the most important cities in the country.  In December 1999 it was named a World Heritage Site.  The people there maintain the culture and traditions of their communities and are known for being pleasant and kind people.

María, 35, is the single mother of two children, ages 15 and 13, who study in a high school in the city.  She does not have her own house so she rents.

She works selling Yanbal and Avon products, and she has been doing this work for ten years.  She also has been selling clothing through a catalogue for three months.

This is her first loan from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying cosmetics.

Her goal is to buy herself a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia El Valle en Cuenca, conocida también como San Bautista de El Valle, parroquia en la que se puede disfrutar de la paz de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
Doña Ana tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de un niño de dos años y medio de edad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Ella tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas e internet hace un año ocho meses, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la remodelación de su local para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Su meta es tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of Primero de Enero Communal Bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the El Valle de Cuenca district, also known as San Bautista de El Valle, where you can enjoy the peace of nature.  The people there are pleasant and kind, and maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.
 
Ana, 34, is the single mother of a two-and-a-half-year-old boy.  The house in which she lives is her own.

She has had an Internet and telephone-booth business for a year and eight months.  She works Sunday through Sunday without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and a half, and she is going to invest her new loan in remodeling her business so she can offer her customers better service.

Her goal is to have a car.

loans.use: to remodel her business.

loans.name: Gladys Edid

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia El Valle en Cuenca, conocida también como San Bautista de El Valle, parroquia en la que se puede desfrutar de la paz de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Gladys tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, la casa en la que vive es de su  propiedad.

Doña Gladys labora como empleada privada hace un año, en sus tiempos libres trabaja en la venta de ropa y joyas de plata, negocio en el que se encuentra hace 4 años.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de joyas de plata para crecer en este negocio.
 
Su sueño es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of Primero de Enero Communal Bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the El Valle de Cuenca district, also known as San Bautista de El Valle, where you can enjoy the peace of nature.  The people there are pleasant and kind, and maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.

Gladys, 26, lives in a common-law relationship from which she has two children, ages 8 and 2.  Her first child, a daughter, studies in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a driver by profession and works driving a truck.  The house in which she lives is her property.

Gladys has worked as a private employee for a year.  In her free time she works selling clothing and silver jewelry, a business she has had for four years.

This is her third loan from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying silver jewelry to grow in this business.

Her dream is to travel around the world.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia El Valle en Cuenca, conocida también como San Bautista de El Valle, parroquia en la que se puede disfrutar de la paz de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Diana tiene 27 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 8, 7 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que viven es  propiedad de familiares.
 
Doña Diana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y en su casa tiene una tienda de comestibles la cual atiende de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es tener casa propia y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of Primero de Enero Communal Bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the El Valle de Cuenca district, also known as San Bautista de El Valle, where you can enjoy the peace of nature.  The people there are pleasant and kind, and maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.

Diana, 27, is married and has three children from this relationship, ages 8, 7, and 2.  Her first two children are going to a school in the city.  Her husband works in construction and the house in which they live is the property of relatives.

Diana works taking care of her home, and in her house she has a grocery store she sees to from Sunday through Sunday from 6 in the morning until 8 at night.

This is her first loan from the communal bank, to which she was invited by a neighbor.  She is going to invest her loan in buying basic household necessities to stock her store.

Her goal is to have her own house and to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy basic household necessities.

loans.name: Mery Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Mary es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que gracias a la belleza de su Centro Histórico y su Cultura fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en diciembre de 1999, cuenta con una gran variedad en la gastronomía, su gente es amable y gentil.
 
Doña Mary tiene 32 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el colegio y su segunda hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo transportes pesados, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Mary se dedica a  la fabricación y venta de juegos pirotécnicos, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y labora en el negocio desde muy joven, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su prima. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra materiales para la realización de los juegos pirotécnicos como carrizo, piola, pólvora, papel, etc. 

Su meta es culminar sus estudios universitarios y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of Yanuncay Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which, thanks to the beauty of its historic center and its culture, was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999. The city has a broad variety of gastronomy, and the people there are pleasant and kind.
 
Mery, 32, is married and has two children from this relationship, ages 14 and 9.  Her oldest child is in high school and her second one, a daughter, is in elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a driver by profession and works transporting heavy loads.  The house in which they live is their property.

Mery works making and selling fireworks.  She learned this job from her parents and worked in the business from a young age.  She works Monday through Saturday without a schedule.
 
This is her first loan from the communal bank, to which she was invited by her cousin.  She is going to invest her loan in buying materials to make fireworks, such as reeds, cord, gunpowder, paper, etc.

Her goal is to finish her university studies and get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy reeds, cord, gunpowder, paper, etc.

loans.name: Raquel Adriana

texts.es:
La Señora. Raquel es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que gracias a la belleza de su Centro Histórico y su Cultura fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en diciembre de 1999, cuenta con una gran variedad en la gastronomía, su gente es amable y gentil. 

La Señora Raquel tiene 26 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 7 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de familiares.
 
Doña Raquel es de profesión Ing. En Contabilidad y lleva la contabilidad del negocio de  su papá, también se dedica a la venta de ropa.
 
Se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su meta es seguir un postgrado de su profeción.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of Yanuncay Communal Bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which, thanks to the beauty of its historic center and its culture, was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  The city has a broad variety of gastronomy and the people there are pleasant and kind.

Raquel, 26, is married and has two children from this relationship, ages 7 and 3.  Her first child studies in elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a shopkeeper.  They do not have their own house so they live in the house of family members.

Raquel is an accountant by profession and does the accounting for her father's business.  She also sells clothing.

She is rejoining the communal bank and will invest her loan in buying supplies for her home.

Her goal is to  do graduate work in her profession.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Emilio is one of the members of the group La Nueva Esperanza (New Hope 2 & 3). This group is comprised of micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, working as educators, and other professions. Members work in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its athletes and sugar industry. Emilio is receiving his ninth loan, almost five years after receiving his first. He has successfully invested and repaid his previous loans. Emilio runs a business where he sells miscellaneous items such as shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and other products.

Emilio is planning to use his loan to buy clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. He will save his profits to continue building his house. Emilio enjoys listening to music, and his goal is to faithfully repay his loans to continue investing in his business. His dream is to improve his social condition and to buy a large vehicle, like a truck or a pick-up truck.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and other items

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Flor is one of the members of La Nueva Esperanza 1 & 4 (New Hope 1 & 4). This group is comprised of micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, working as educators, and other professions. Members work in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its athletes and sugar industry. At present, its economy depends on duty-free industrial zones, the cement industry, and other minor activities like tourism. 

Flor is the mother of two children. Together with her husband, she has been able to provide necessities for her family. She works selling clothing. Four years after receiving her first loan, she is receiving her eleventh loan. Flor has successfully invested and repaid her previous loans.

Flor is planning to use her new loan to purchase new clothes for men, women, and children. The most difficult part of her work is collecting money from people who have bought products on credit. Flor will save her earnings to continue providing necessities for her home and finish building her house. Flor's favorite activity is studying. Her dream is to graduate as a computer engineer while pursuing her business and to be able to pay for her college education.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Paix Plus Group

texts.en: Evelyne is the leader of a community bank named Paix Plus, which is composed of 11 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. Evelyne is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five children, of whom three go to school. Evelyne sells loaves of bread. She has been in business since 2004, with a beginning capital of US $50. After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program she decided to join one of its groups in November 2007. Evelyne has already received nine loans from Hope that she repaid correctly. With her next loan she is planning to purchase 250 trays of loaves of bread to increase the inventory of her business in order to generate more profit. Every month her business generates a profit of US $500. Evelyne’s dream is to be a provider of those products in her area. She runs her business in the southwestern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to reinforce her working capital and purchase 250 trays of loaves of bread to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Prodige Plus Group

texts.en:
Damien is the leader of the community bank named “Prodige Plus." It is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Damien is a carpenter, and a sofa and armchair maker. He is also an upholsterer. In addition to that, he runs a general store. He opened it in 2009 with a beginning capital of US $50. He has been a micro entrepreneur since 1978.

In 2009, when he learned about Hope from one of his friends, he decided to join the group that was formed in his area--Prodige Plus. He took the first US $60 loan to open a small general store. Damien is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will, with his next loan, purchase the raw materials, including timber, to allow him to make a sofa and two armchairs to sell at profit, and reinforce the inventory of his store. Currently, he earns a profit of US $400 per month. Damien and his family are gradually becoming financially independent. He is married and the father of four children between the ages of 17 and 30 years old. One of them goes to school.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, including timber, for his workshop

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cloche Plus Group

texts.en:
Angel is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Cloche Plus,” which means "bell" in English. It is composed of 10 micro entrepreneurs. These members are united for the same goal--to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Angel is 30 years old. Her activity is selling timber. She buys timber in bulk and resells it in detail at a profit. She sells her products daily in her area.

Angel started her business in 2004. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having nine times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Her next loan will allow her to increase her stock by buying timber in larger quantities and increase her sales to make a better profit. Angel makes a profit of about US $50 per week. She is married and the mother of three children whose ages range between 6 months and 9 years old. One of them goes to school. She is also responsible for her niece.

loans.use: to increase her stock by buying timber in large quantities and reselling it at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Version Plus Group

texts.en:
Philo is the leader of the community bank named “Version Plus,” which is composed of nine members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Philo is 45 years old, married, and the mother of four children, whose ages range between 9 and 19 years old. Four of her children attend school. Philo has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2005. She operates a general store in the west of Kinshasa. She works hard and employs good management skills in order to realize her dream of someday becoming a main provider in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which currently earns her US $180 per week. Philo has already obtained and correctly repaid 21 loans from microfinance institution and Kiva partner HOPE DRC. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying four sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, two boxes of cans, and two boxes of soap to resell at a profit.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying four sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, two boxes of cans, and two boxes of soap to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bénédiction Plus Group

texts.en:
Bénédiction Plus is a group of eight owners of small businesses, chaired by René. Its members are jointly responsible for loans granted by Kiva through the micro-finance institution HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

René sells drinks in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has been in the business world since 2007, selling the same product. With hard work and good management, he succeeded in making his business thrive, thanks to the accumulated profits. He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received 19 different loans and has repaid them properly. He plans to use the coming loan to diversify his business by adding fresh food needed in his area. Currently, his business brings in a profit of US $200 per week. He dreams of one day opening a large drink facility in his environment. René is 53 years old, married, and the father of five children whose ages vary between 4 and 12 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to diversify his business by adding fresh food needed in his area

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Luzolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Sami, age 40, is the chairman of the community group named Luzolo Plus, which consists of 8 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through its partnering microfinance institution, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. Sami is married and the father of four children between 2 and 11 years old. Three of them attend school.

Sami has been in the microenterprise world since 2001. He has been selling drinks. His drink facility is located west of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of HOPE RDC and has already received five different loans and repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of his goods by buying 20 crates of drinks with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $210. His ambition is to open a larger drink facility in his area.

loans.use: to increase his stock of his goods by buying 20 crates of drinks for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 35-year-old man living in Taiz, Yemen. He is a father of two children. His background education is Chartered Accountant. Khalid's business is a grocery store that he started 15 years ago with limited capital and income. He knows how to attract customers through the service that he provides and the prices that he offers. His main customers are the homemakers living in his neighborhood and the local community. So, he is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. 

Being an ambitious man, Khalid would like to expand his business. So he took a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to rent a separate space and increase the variety of products. 

In the future, he hopes to purchase a truck, which he will use to pick up goods from wholesalers to take to his grocery and to purchase another shop to open, an accounting office, which has a network of branches, titled by his name.

loans.use: to rent a separate space and increase the variety of products

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is 24 years old. He is the second oldest son among seven brothers and sisters. 

Hamzah is studying to become a lawyer in one of the private universities in Jordan. He has applied for this loan to pay for his semester’s fees so he can register and continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay for his semester’s fees

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, 46 years old, is a  widow who is raising five sons and daughters by herself. To be able to support her family and improve their financial situation, Iman started buying and selling blankets at her house. 

Today Iman has applied for a loan in order to buy more products so she can increase her income and be able to support her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and other products

loans.name: Basima

texts.en:
Basima, 47 years old, is a  housewife. She has six daughters. The oldest, Khadija, is now studying in the university majoring in special needs studies in her fourth year.

Since the family has no income beside her father’s retirement salary, Khadija is hoping that she can graduate as soon as possible so she can find a job and help support the family. In order to help her daughter achieve that and for the sake of the rest of her sisters, Basima has applied for a loan so they can pay for Khadija’s semester’s fees.

Because Basima is a conservative person, her daughter Khadija has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's semester fees

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard is from the village of Totosgyugh in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – a 24-year-old daughter and two sons (24 and 26 years old).  Alvard has a high school education and has been working as a farmer for the past 25 years.  She also helps support her relatives living in the city with agricultural products grown on the family farm.  She would like a loan to purchase livestock and animal feed.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by ten percent.  Alvard dreams of continuing to grow her business, which she can pass on to her children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is happily married with two sons (22 and 25 years old).  She has a secondary school education and has been farming for the past 20 years.  Marine considers herself a hardworking and honest person.  In addition to supporting her family, she also helps her relatives living in Gyumri.  Her son is studying theater and hopes to be a famous actor.  Marine wants her children to live happy lives.  She would like a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.  This investment should increase the family income by fifteen percent.  Marine has a positive opinion of microfinance services and the favorable conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Pokr Sepasar.  She is married with two children – a ten-year-old daughter and a thirteen-year-old son.  Gohar has a high school education and has been farming for the past fifteen years.  She would like to expand her business and provide for her children’s education.  Gohar would like a loan to purchase additional livestock.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by 15%.  Gohar is pleased with the conditions of microfinance and the well-organized loan collection process in her village.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is from the village of Ashotck in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two sons (27 and 30 years old). Rima has a high school education and has been farming for 30 years.  She also helps one of her sons with his private business.  Rima is a hardworking person who is devoted to her family.  She would like a loan to purchase animal feed.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by 10%.  She is pleased with the favorable conditions of microfinance.  Rima’s personal investment in her business is three times more than the amount of her debt and she is confident she will repay the debt.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Kaps.  She is married with three children – a 26-year-old daughter and two sons (14 and 24).  She has a high school education and has been farming for the past 20 years.  She dreams of renovating the family home.  She would like a loan to purchase livestock and feed.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by 20%.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance.  She is keeping her debt to less than 40% of her equity in the business.

loans.use: to purchase seed and livestock

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is from the village of Azatan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is the proud mother of five children – four daughters (20, 23, 26, and 27 years old) and a ten-year-old son.  She has a high school education and, together with her husband, has been farming for the past 30 years.  Anahit also helps her relatives in Gyumri with produce from the family farm.  She would like a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.  Anahit expects this investment to increase the family income by 15%.  She dreams of expanding the family business to pass it on to her children.  She enjoys farming and living in Azatan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira is from the village of Azatan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – a 15-year-old daughter and two sons (eight and ten years old).  Naira is a trained nurse but due to difficult economic times, she has been farming for the past 20 years.  Naira also helps her relatives with potatoes grown on the family farm.  She is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by 20%.  She is pleased with the terms and conditions of microfinance.  Naira is keeping her debt below 20% of her invested equity in the business.  Naira dreams that her children will receive university educations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is from the village of Shirak in Armenia.  She is married with two children – a 20-old-daughter and a 22-year-old son.  Ruzanna has a high school education.  She just recently moved to the village of Shirak from the city of Gyumri and has been farming for the past three years.  She is a hardworking person and dreams of owning her own bakery one day.  She is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fuel.  This investment should increase the family income by fifteen percent.  As Ruzanna is saving for her bakery, she is keeping her debt below twenty-five percent of her invested equity in the business.  She likes living in Shirak surrounded by good friends and relatives.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel

loans.name: Radilla

texts.en:
Radilla is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Radilla is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Radilla is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many others. Radilla has been in her business for over three years and earns 3,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Radilla is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2009, Radilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Vian Jhon

texts.en: Vian Jhon used his last loan to purchase a motorcycle sidecar. He successfully purchased the sidecar, so he is taking a new loan for the registration of his motorcycle. In the future, he hopes to have an additional passenger motorcycle.

loans.use: to register his motorcycle

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem, 40, is married with four single children, living in Prey Chor district. At present, she works as a rice farmer to generate income, earning approximately $2.00 per day through this business, whereas her husband is an animal farmer raising poultry at home. Moreover, he always assists Mrs. Sem in her farming work.

Now Mrs. Sem would like her first loan from HKL and Kiva to buy cows for her farming project because in the previous years, Mrs. Sem used to hire her neighbor’s animals for the process. She is very appreciative of all lenders. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy cows for her farming project.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men, 56, is a humble farmer who grows some crops like rice, potatoes and watermelons. She is from the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She manages this business with a great help from her husband who always assists her in the project. Currently, Mrs. Men has been blessed with eight children: five children are married; two among the three single children continue studying and work in Phnom Penh city. Due to the lack of a vehicle, they have some difficulties in traveling to school and workplaces. To solve the problem, Mrs. Men, a loving mother, is applying for a loan from HKL to purchase a motorcycle for the two children who are in need. In the future, Mrs. Men aims to expand her farmland and grows many kinds of crops, which earns her a good income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the two children who are in need.

loans.name: Suvd-Erdene

texts.en: This time Mrs. Suvd-Erdene is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing a new car. It is needed so she can start a taxi business in addition to her beauty salon business. As she said, she will run her new business two days a week. If it starts, her earnings will be increased notably than even before.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new car for her new taxi business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie, a 20-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from retailing rice.

Having borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF, Jennie is now requesting a new loan for PHP 20000 to purchase more store stock to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more store stock to sell.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin, a 32-year-old married mother of three, resides in Prey Chor District where she works hard in her rice field. She has a life partner in her husband, who provides a motor-taxi service to local people. Recently Chhin’s husband has encountered business difficulties due to frequent mechanical problems with his old motorcycle. To solve the problem, Chhin is requesting this loan from HKL to purchase a motorbike to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car and buy jerry cans

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia believes that, " a hard working person becomes successful". She is a hard working mother who helps her husband in managing their corn farming business. She is 56 years old and has four adult-age children. They have been a farmer for almost 23 years and usually earns a profits of P25,000 in every harvest season. They usually spend their income for their food and allowances of their children. Being a hard working parents, they educate most of their children. 

They planned to improve and expand their corn farming business to earn and save for their daily living and future emergencies. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting corn. They believe that they can able to increase their yields and income as they continue to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting corn

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old and is married with two children. She resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. For the past three years, Anita has owned and operated a business weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials. She earns 2,000 PHP each month. Anita joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Anita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. In the future, she wants to improve her house and expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her son

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Adelaida is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Adelaida is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Adelaida has been in her business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Adelaida is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Adelaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is married and has seven children. He is 52 years old and resides at Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Harold is operating a raising crops venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In 2011, Harold joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Harold wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another piece of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman who has three children. Teresita is 46 years old and resides in Balili, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Teresita own and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living conditions. In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Leofe

texts.en:
Leofe is 30 years old and lives in Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Leofe is a married and has two children. 

Leofe plants, harvests and sells coconuts to earn a living and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2012, Leofe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Leofe wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 60 years old, married and has 10 adult children. 

Eufemia owns and operates a retail business, selling home products to local community members. Eufemia has been in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Eufemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn, aged 32, a mother of three school-age children, has been living in Takhmao town, where working in agriculture is common for local people. To earn a living, she grows rice and some types of vegetables, earning approximately $5.00 per day to meet the needs of her family. Her husband is a security guard for a private company; however, he also uses some free time to help Sorn on their farmland. 

Now Sorn needs some funds from Kiva to start planting her dry-season rice again for the year. This is her third loan from HKL. With the previous loans, Sorn has never made any late payments and she has paid them off successfully. She said this loan is very important to sustain her agricultural business.

loans.use: to start planting her dry-season rice again.

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Raymund is 27 years old, is married and lives in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

He is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for six years and every month he earns 2,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

In 2009, Raymund joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Raymund hopes to double his income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Chang

texts.en:
Chang, 61, is a skillful farmer who has been involved in crop husbandry for more than 20 years. However, she performs her farming tasks by using traditional methods as do other local cultivators. She knows how to keep her land fertile and how to protect her crops from the challenges of insects. She has been blessed with five children, four of whom are already married and all live independently except for her youngest child. 

Chang is seeking a loan from our lenders to pay for rented farmland, on which she will grow rice and potatoes as well. For her business goal, she aims to own a few plots of farmland, thereby increasing her household income.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.
Nemesia has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net and other materials for fishing. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 48 years old and married with 12 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Meriam has been raising livestock for seven years and also earns additional income by buying and selling charcoal and bananas.

Meriam is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Doan

texts.en: Doan is taking out a loan for her son, Dang. When he was a child, Dang wished to become a pharmacist. Currently he is a first year student of chemistry at Hanoi University.  After graduation in 2016, he will work for a phamaceutical company. Therefore, he is studying hard to receive good results. All the expenditure is too high for him to afford. His mother wants to have a loan partly to pay tuition fees and for other costs.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees and other costs.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is taking out a loan for her daughter, Ngoc, who is a student at the Hanoi Economic Industry College. She is studying in the accounting faculty.  After graduation in 2014, she will find a job as an accountant in a company in Bacninh province. Currently, she wants her mother to borrow a loan to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Uyanga, aged 34, is a workshop lessor and, in addition, runs a taxi business. She owns two small apartments in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and rents all rooms in both at a low price. Uyanga lives with her husband and her three children. 

Lately her taxi car has become old and needs most of its parts renewed because she is the third owner of her old car. She is planning that the car will run more successfully after its renovation. Also it will positively influence the service quality and her customers' satisfaction. The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing new spare parts for her car renovation.

loans.use: To purchase new spare parts for her car renovation.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita works hard to support her family. She is married and makes bags and mats in the Philippines. Estelita has been in this business for five years now.

Estelita has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en: Baasankhuu, aged 35, is the host of the bathhouse in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running it since last spring and already has many permanent customers. He supplies water from the other baths by using a one ton cistern truck. But last month, his truck engine and gearbox broke down completely due to damage. Therefore he needs to repair his truck immediately in order to recommence his business. Otherwise, as he said, if it continues for many days, he will lose most of his customers. The loan he is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing the spare parts for his truck repair.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his truck repair.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 39 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari sari store.

Analiza has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from her boarding house business. Analiza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married with three children who are currently going to school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Leah has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Leah has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat. In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Ma.victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria works hard to support her family. Ma. Victoria is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Victoria requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Ms Binh is 42 years old with two children who are in secondary school and elementary school. Binh is a farmer. She grows rice and cherry blossoms  to sell on Tet holiday.  In addition, she raises chickens for meat.  Taking part in our credit program since 2003, she has used loans effectively in expanding her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnam dong to buy food and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy food and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nhuong's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nhuong is 48 years old with one son. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing cherry blossoms and raising chickens for eggs. Her business started eight years ago and creates a good income for her to manage her family life. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam dong to buy feed for her chickens.

Ms. Huyen is 26 years old with two children. She is raising chickens for eggs and growing cherry blossoms. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnam dong to buy food and fertilizer

Mr. Khoi is 22 years old. He is a driver. He wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 to repair his car.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is 53 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Nelie has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin, age 51, lives with her family in the Baray district. She and her husband are in the same type of business, cultivating rice through the year. She has been in this business for ages. Besides rice crops, she also grows potatoes, which are now ripe enough to harvest. She is a proud of farmer who owns a 3 hectare potato plantation. Presently she has 6 children, 4 of whom are single and unemployed.
 
With the sum of $600, Hin will pay for farm laborers to harvest her potatoes. She will give the remaining funds to two of her children who are going to work in a neighboring country, Thailand. Hin has tried in her business to pursue a good quality of life, and she hopes to obtain it someday.

loans.use: to pay for farm laborers to harvest her potatoes.

loans.name: Ma.cristina

texts.en:
Ma.Cristina is 40 years old and married with 2 children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, etc. In the future Ma.Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong was born in 1981.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing cherry blossoms to sell in the Tet holiday.  Besides that, she is a tailor and also raises chickens for meat. Her business started 8 years ago and it creates good income for her family life.  For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy chicken feed, and also fabric for her sewing.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and fabric for her sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 56-year-old widow with 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

She has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Marilyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai, a widow, is 58 years old with 3 children. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing cherry blossoms and raising chickens for eggs. Her business started 10 years ago and creates good income for her to manage her family's life.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnam dong to buy  chicken feed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy takes loans out for her son, Quyet. He is studying at Hanoi University of Industry. He will graduate in 2013 with the degree of electrical engineer. He hopes to find a job in a factory in Hanoi. Now, he is sharing a rental house in Hanoi. Paying tuition fees and house rental payments are his main difficulties. His mother wants to borrow a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to solve this.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees and house rental.

loans.name: Chien

texts.en: Chien takes loans out for her son, Tung, who is student at the Natural Resource and Environment University. After graduation in 2013, he wants to be an environmental technical engineer and work for the environmental protection department in Bac Ninh Province. To make the dream come to true, he is studying well to have good results. Therefore, his mother wants to borrow a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay tuition fees and buy other supplies.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy supplies.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Ms Hoa takes a loan out for her daughter Yen, who is student at Dong A Technology University.  She is studying Accounting. After graduation in 2014, she will find a job as an accountant in a company in Bacninh province.  Currently, she wants to borrow money to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a 32-year-old married woman with two young children aged eleven and two. Her husband works as a driver. Lucille lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Lucille has been a farmer for five years. She grows rice and vegetables to sell at her town's market. Lucille earns about 6000 PHP per month through farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

In the future, Lucille hopes for her children to finish college, and for her family to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bibiana's Group

texts.en:
Bibiana is the coordinator of her group "Trabajando para el Manana" 1, 2 & 3 (Working for Tomorrow). Bibiana is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around 4 years, starting to work out of her house after her partner-in-love gave her money to start her business. 

Bibiana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 4 children. She says that her biggest challenge is to help her children to become professionals. She said her most favorite activities are attending to her family and spending great moments with them.

She plans to use this loan to buy ingredients like meat, flour, seasoning, cooking oil and vegetables. She sells empanada, which is a round of flour dough filled with meat or vegetables and fried, a popular snack food.

She thanks you all for helping her and her goup to "improve my family´s life, myself and all the members from this group."

The group pictures are separated; these three pictures make the complete group of 15.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, seasoning, cooking oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a 43-year-old married woman with 3 children aged 20, 17 and 15.  Ma. Chona's husband is a businessman.

Ma. Chona is a dry goods retailer in Trinidad, Bohol.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She sells men and women's shirts, jeans, undergarments and bed sheets. She earns about 40000 php per month with her business. Ma. Chona works hard to improve her business and sustain her family.  She also makes her children's education a top priority.

Ma. Chona has requested this loan to buy 10 dozen blouses and 10 dozen shirts.  She also plans to pay her children's tuition fees.  In the future, she hopes her business will last for many years and hopes that her children will finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen blouses and 10 dozen shirts and pay tuition fees

loans.name: Jane Atieno

texts.en:
Jane Atieno is a 37 year old boutique owner in Bombolulu, Mombasa. She is single and a mother of two. She has been running this business for the last one year with great success.

This is Jane’s first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers and handbags to resell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers and handbags

loans.name: Mutisya

texts.en:
Mutisya is a 33 year hawker of assorted goods in Voi. He is single. He has been doing this business for the past six years and he is doing great.
 
This is Mutisya’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase basins, torches, earrings, keyholders and bangles to resell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase basins, torches, earrings, keyholders and bangles

loans.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding is 45 year old a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school.  For the past 2 years, she has a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan.
Ding is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Abul

texts.en:
Abul is a 38-year-old married woman with five children, and three of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Abul is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, 50 years old, is a mixed-crop farmer. She is a single mother of two children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Priscilla will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Naomi Nduta

texts.en:
Naomi Nduta is a 46-year-old business lady in Voi who makes detergents. She is a married mother of three. She has been making detergents and selling them for the past two years successfully.

This is Naomi’s first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase detergent chemicals and empty bottles for packaging. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase detergent chemicals and empty bottles for packaging.

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children, age 10, 6 and 3 years old.  Her spouse is a businessman who contributes a monthly income to the family. 

She owns a chemist or drugstore in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Lenah is requesting a loan from KADET Ltd. of KES 30,000 and wishes to use this amount to purchase assorted drugs for sale in her chemist. The profits will be used to expand her chemist and repay the loan.

She hopes for her business to be self-sustainable and to improve her family's living standards
.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Achok

texts.en:
Achok is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, and all of them are in school. 

She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Achok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Fanshaline

texts.en:
Fanshaline is a single lady, 38 years old and blessed with two children, age 16 and 6. 

She operates a retail shop in in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000 that she uses to support her family.

She has borrowed a first term loan of KES 30,000 and wishes to use this amount to purchase one bag of sugar, 50 kg. of rice, two cartons of cooking fat and four bales of maize flour. The proceeding profits will be plowed back into the business.

Her dream is to prosper in her business and educate her children.
