loans.use: To purchase stock such as one bag of sugar, 50 kg. of rice, two cartons of cooking fat and four bales of maize flour for her shop.

loans.name: Nyanbiop

texts.en: Nyanbiop, a 32-year-old married woman, has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan for the past three years. Now requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and wheat flour to sell, she will use the resulting extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 60 years old and is married with two children. She is from Carmen Annex, Misamis Occidental. For the past six years, Ethel has been selling rice and corn in the local community. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month.  Ethel joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Ethel is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase rice and corn to resell. She will use the additional revenue generated from her loan to save as a reserve for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with a three-year-old child and has been a farmer for 10  years. Martin's farm produces milk, vegetables, and poultry for the local market. He also works as a motorcycle driver to earn extra income. Martin states that animal diseases and occasional droughts are the major challenges in his farming business, but he remains optimistic his business will be better.

Martin is requesting a 61,500 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his dairy and poultry farming businesses. He believes the loan will improve his farming income and enable him provide better living standards for his young family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and poultry

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 46 years old. He lives in the village Kindzati, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: his wife Fatman, and two sons who are 23 and 20 years old. George earns a living through agriculture and has a small dairy farm with a milk cow and a calf. The family sells cheese and they own 1.5 hectares of land where they grow haricot, maize, and beets. George's younger son is a car mechanic and works in the village. The family's total average monthly income is 800 GEL. 

George is requesting a loan to purchase and raise six calves. Beginning next year his family will be able to sell 600% more cheese which will significantly increase their income. George will use the profit from his loan to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase six calves

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is aged 27 and has been in farming for five years, producing eggs, onions and carrots going to the local market in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya where she does her farming. She also operates a grocery business in the market to add to her farming income.

Esther has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the venture will provide her family  with milk for daily consumption as well as earn income from the sales to provide other basic needs. She hopes to improve her farming too with the income from the dairy business.

Esther says animal diseases remain the major threat to their businesses.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is  a 31-year-old  married woman living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a grain milling machine which she has operated for over six years.

Christine started with a stationery shop and after realizing that the benefits were not feasible she ventured into a grain milling business. Her goals are educating her children, building a permanent house, and buying herself a car. Her business dream is to buy three more machines since the demand is very high.

Christine needs the loan to purchase a another grain-milling machine.

loans.use: to buy a new a grain milling machine.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en:
Mrs. Choem is a responsible mother of four children as well as a humble villager who is involved in agriculture. She permanently lives with her own family in Prey Chor district. She grows rice alongside her husband in the rainy season and vegetable crops after that. She also acts as a greengrocer occasionally, after harvesting her vegetable crops from the field. She earns around $3.00 per day from her business and tries hard to support her unemployed children. 

For her first loan from Kiva, Choem would like to pay rented farmland fees, which willcost $600.  For her prospects, she intends to improve and expand her farming business. And she wishes to own some pieces of farmland one day.

loans.use: to pay rent for farmland.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry is 39 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and is a father of one school-aged child. 

Gerry is a motorcycle "habal-habal" driver who owns and operates his own business. He provides passenger services to his local community. He has been engaged in this business for two years. 

Each month, Gerry earns approximately PHP 5,000 from this work. Gerry has been a member of GDMPC for two years. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase a motorcycle sidecar. In the future, Gerry hopes to purchase another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle sidecar.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 39-year-old businessman. He is married to Agnes who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children. Gabriel has been in the livestock trading business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

Gabriel is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Gabriel will use the loan to buy more livestock for trading. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His dream is to buy a pick-up truck for transporting his stock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy more livestock for trading.

loans.name: Aroum

texts.en:
Aroum is a 36-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She has had a business of selling sugar in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Aroum is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.ru: Жамал 56 лет, вдова, воспитала пятерых детей.  Жамал 20 лет назад начала свой бизнес в животноводстве.  Начатое с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов.   В данный момент, семья Жамал обрабатывает  2 га орошаемой земли , где выращивают картошку. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Жамал обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец. Доходы от кредита Жамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины, и в ближайшем будущем –купить машину для своей семьи.
texts.en: Jamal is 56 years old, a widow, who raised five children.  She started her animal husbandry business 20 years old.  The business, started with an initial sum of 1,000 som (KGS), today yields about 6,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  Currently, Jamal's family works on 2 hectares of irrigated land, where they grow potatoes.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Jamal requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls and sheep.  She plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing quantities of domestic livestock and purchasing a car for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Johnstone Shamia

texts.en:
Johnstone Shamia  is a 56-year-old electrician who also owns an electrical appliances shop in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is married. He has been selling electrical appliances and doing electronics repairs for the last two years with success. 

This is Johnstone’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase more sockets, soldering wires and bulbs. He will use the anticipated profits to build rental houses and expand his business further. He hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sockets, soldering wires and bulbs.

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
Cyril is a 57-year-old married man from Kamwenge, Uganda, who lives in a semi-permanent house. For the past 30 years he has been an agriculturalist who grows pineapples. He began with one acre of pineapples and currently he has four acres under cultivation. 

Cyril is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to transport his pineapples to market. His goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house, and buy a truck, since his major business difficulty is the high cost of transport.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport produce to market

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 38 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is responsible for taking care of her three children. Robinah runs a general store and she used a loan to start her current business.

Robinah is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, and salt to sell. She would like to use the profits from her loan to educate her children and build a permanent house. In the future, she would like to diversify her business and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and salt to sell

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 28-year-old married woman with two young children ages 6 and 4. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Mirasol has been a farmer for five years and she grows vegetables to sell at her town's market. She does her best to improve her business and take care of her children. 

Mirasol is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to improve her crop yield and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a  63-year-old businessman who is married to Domifila, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children, ages 26, 24 and 19.  For the past 27 years, David has been a livestock trader. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES that he uses to support his family.

David is applying for his fourth loan with KADET to buy more livestock to trade. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. David will use the anticipated profit from his business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pick-up truck to transport his stock to different markets.

loans.use: to buy livestock to trade

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 32 years old, married with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retail shop owner and he has been in business for five years. He started with farming where he saved money and then started a retail business. His goals are educating his children and owning a wholesale shop. 

Stephen wants the loan to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy  soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 37-year-old married woman with two children; both of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old, married with three children, and living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For six years he has been running a workshop. His goal is educating his children and diversifying his business to include welding. His major challenge is limited funds and lack of electricity in his premises.

Paul needs the loan to install electricity in his workshop.

loans.use: to install electricity in his workshop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 41 years old and a businessman. He is married to Catherine, a farmer. They are blessed with three children aged 12, eight and three years respectively. He has been in the livestock trading business for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. James will use the loan to buy more livestock for trading. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy a pick-up for transporting his livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy more livestock for trading.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda and his personal goal is to educate his children and complete his residential house. He has been in the transport sector for the last seven years and his major hardship is repair costs, however, he has a vision of expanding his business into new markets.

Christopher needs a loan to buy doors and windows for his house.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Kasoso Baji

texts.en:
Kasoso Baji is a 54-year-old bakery owner in Mariakani. He is a married father of five. He has been running the bakery business for the past 25 years and he is doing great.

This is Kasoso’s first business loan from KADET. He plans to purchase new ovens, baking flour and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase new ovens, baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 45-year-old married mother of seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. With a personal goal of educating her children, Grace operates a produce business and  is now requesting a loan to buy beans and ground nuts for resale. Despite the major hardships of price fluctuations and inflation, she has a vision of expanding her business into new markets and diversifying to include crop production.

loans.use: to buy  beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years. 

Akeer is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bin, age 31, a mother of four children, owns a plantation, where she and her husband grow banana crops. She has been in the business since 2005, that's why she has good experience in running and operating her business. 

Besides growing bananas herself, she sometimes buys them from other villagers and takes them to sell at a reasonable price in a market of the province. So now Bin is seeking a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy bananas in bulk from other farmers' plantations. 

Bin is very appreciative and hopes that her project will be successful, thereby increasing her income to satisfy the whole family.

loans.use: to buy bananas in bulk from other farmers’ plantations.

loans.name: Yosinta

texts.en: Yosinta used the previous loan to buy Irish potatoes for resale. The 31-year-old woman has a dream of setting up a food store that can supply the schools around the Rwenzori region despite challenges of price fluctuations and inflation. She now needs another loan to buy more Irish potatoes since the business is very lucrative.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 36-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for three years. 

Rebecca is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 36-year-old, married man with children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He first worked as a hawker, but he now owns a retail shop that sells clothes and dressmaking supplies. He has run this business for more than 5 years. His goals are to educate his children and diversify his business to include shoes. 

Ibrahim needs the loan to buy clothes for sell at his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell at his retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cabbage, oranges, bananas, tomatoes and kale to sell.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 39 years old and married with two children who both attend school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Almira has a clothing retail business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for four years.  

Almira requested a 23,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items like blouses, t-shirts, cosmetics and other personal products to sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, t-shirts, cosmetics and other personal products to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 55-year-old, married woman with two children.  Her youngest child is 18 years old and still attends school.  Narcisa is a farmer in San Miguel, Bohol Province in the Philippines.  She has been growing and selling rice for twenty years.  Narcisa provides for her family with her farming income.  She works hard to support her family and send her child to school.

Narcisa has requested this loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.  She hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Damianus

texts.en:
Damianus is a 41-year-old, married man with children.  He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Damianus is a teacher and he has his own school that he has run for eight years. His goals are to build a permanent house and expand his school.  He faces the hardship of inadequate capital to purchase the necessary equipment.

Damianus requests the loan to buy desks, beds and other school equipment.

loans.use: to buy desks, beds and other school equipment for the school he runs.

loans.name: Provia

texts.en:
Provia is a 38-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda, in a semi-permanent house. She deals in second-hand clothes, a business she has done for six years. She started as a hawker but now sells from one rented place. Her dream is to own a boutique despite the challenges of limited capital.

Provia needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante is a 41-year-old man who lives in the village of San Antonio with his wife and three kids. He is a persevering and very responsible man with a great desire to get ahead every day. For eight years, Dante has run a grocery store in town. He sells mostly food products and manages to earn a significant income, which enables him to provide for his family. His business is the only income for the family. Dante requested a loan of P 10,000 to increase his revenues.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, shampoo and snack foods for her store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
To generates additional income, Maricel engages herself in vegetable vending in their village. She is 33 years old and has five children. Being a responsible parent, they want to educate their children and give them a better life. They planned to improve their sources of income so that they can able to support the education of their children and satisfy their daily necessities. 

Maricel aimed to acquire more vegetables to sell to sell in their village but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy onions, cabbages, bitter melons, garlics, squashes, cauliflowers and tomatoes to sell. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and hoping that she will increase her income to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to buy onions, cabbages, bitter melons, garlics, squashes, cauliflowers and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with four children, aged 20, 13, 9 and 6.

Ramon has been a farmer for five years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Ramon works hard to feed his family and send his children to school. He requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ramon hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest.

In the future, Ramon hopes for his children to finish their studies and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is a 47-year-old divorced woman with eight children living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on her, and her dream is to see her children graduating. 

She deals in a second-hand clothes, a business she has done for 15 years. Her goals are educating her children and trading on a wholesale basis. 

Joselyne needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mr. Yem, 28, is a policeman who is living together with his younger sister in Dongkor commune. He is a single man and his sister is a university student in Phnom Penh city. Presently, Mr. Yem’s house is under construction. However, due to lack of some funds, it’s not completely built. In order to enable the performance of the laborers, Mr. Yem decided to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to complete the construction. He tells us that he is very confident he will pay his loan back to our lenders regularly and punctually based on the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to complete the construction of his house.

loans.name: Samwel Owuor

texts.en:
Samwel Owuor is a 25-year-old businessman who owns an electronics shop in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is married and has been selling electronics and doing electronics repair for the last five years. His business is doing great. 

This is Samwel’s third business loan from KADET. He plans to purchase bulbs, testers, extensions and soldering wires. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and repay his loan. He hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: to purchase bulbs, testers, extensions and soldering wires.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily has been with KADET LTD and is servicing her third loan from KADET LTD after paying back the previous loans successfully. She does dairy farming on their farm in Kiboswa location and has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. Even the monthly income has not changed  She very happy with the progress.

She will use the loan to purchase more dairy cows and improve the dairy farm.  The profits will be used to repay the loan and plow back into the farm.

She hopes to improve in dairy farming and have a bright family.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy cows

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Magdalena is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Magdalena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Magdalena has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is a widow and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said is a 36-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from five to 12 years old. He describes himself to be honest, committed and responsible. He operates a retail store where he sells sugar, wheat flour, salt, painkillers etc. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a residential area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods sold. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, salt, wheat flour, etc. His business goal is to be the main supplier near his town area within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, wheat flour, salt, sugar etc.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Ms Giang is a 43-year-old mother of one daughter who is a worker. As a farmer, Giang has focused on growing cherry blossoms and bonsai trees for 10 years, earning sufficient income to help her to manage family life.

A participant in our credit program since 2004, she has used loans effectively in expanding her business. Giang is now requesting a loan of 9,374,000 Vietnam dong to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar, a 37-year-old married man with the responsibility of looking after his children, used his previous loan to buy fuel and building materials such as sand, bricks and stones to sell. The resulting profits enabled him to diversify his business and provide the basics for his family.

Still facing the challenge of limited funds to meet increasing customer demand, Abubakar is requesting this loan to buy more fuel, sand, bricks, and stones for resale.

loans.use: to buy fuel, sand, bricks, and stones for resale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 25-year-old married woman who started her business with the help of her family seven years ago. She runs a grocery store that sells mostly snacks and some basic food products such as sugar, salt, etc. Now she has applied for a loan amounting P 25,000 to buy more food products so she can expand her business and is able to serve more people.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks, noodles and coffee for her store

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Ms Tam is 38 years old with 3 children of school age. She  has been running a small restaurant that serves breakfast for the last 3 years. In addition, she grows cheery blossom for the Tet holidays. Joining in our credit program in 2003, she used the loan she undertook effectively to expand her business activities. Currently, she wants a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam Dong to buy kitchens equipment and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy kitchens equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She has five children and all of them are in school. She has a poultry project and this also enables her to provide the basic necessities to her family and also to pay the loan installments. She needs another loan to pay school fees since a new school term is approaching.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with 8 children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Rosario has had a sari-sari store business for the last 10 years. She sells items like canned goods, cooking oil, shampoo and soap. Rosario's income is used to fulfill her family's daily needs. She works hard to improve her business and to continue supporting her family.

Rosario has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as soft-drinks, rice and sugar. Rosario hopes to have a better income so she could help send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft-drinks, rice and sugar

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a single lady, aged 38 years old.  She is  a parent of four children, aged 17, 15, 13 and 11 years old.  She operates a dairy farm in Kosirai  and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,500.

Viola has borrowed a second loan from KADET LTD for KES 30,000 after she has repaid the previous one successfully.  She wishes to use this money to improve her dairy farm and purchase feeds for her dairy livestock.  The profits will be used to purchase a plot of land.  

Her dream is to  improve the number of dairy animals on her farm and educate her children.

loans.use: improve her dairy farm and purchase livestock feeds

loans.name: Can's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Can is 55 years old and has 1 son.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing cherry blossoms and raising chickens for eggs. Her business started  8 years ago and creates good income for her to support her  family life.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of VND 5,014,000 to buy food for chickens and fertilizer.

Ms. Huong is 39 years old and has 3 children. She is growing cherry blossoms. She wants to have a loan of VND 7,630,000  to buy fertilizer.

Ms. Dong is 44 years old and has 2 children.  Being a teacher, after school working hours, she grows and runs a bonsai tree business. She wants to have a loan of VND 8,502,000 to buy more trees.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 31 years old and single.  He is a dairy businessman.  He has been in the dairy farming business for the past 15 years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

Boniface is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully.  He will use this loan to buy animal feed.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, Boniface will buy a heifer. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming, which will help him improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy salt, sugar and sodas

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 39 years old married to Jacob. They have five children of the following ages: 18, 15, 13, 12, and 10 years respectively. She sells timber and has been in business for thirteen years. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more timber for sale. She will repay her loan with the anticipated profit.

loans.use: to purchase timber for sale.

loans.name: Muoi's Group

texts.en:
Ms Muoi is  24 years old with 1 small child.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing  rice, raising chickens. Besides, she is managing a small  hair cut shop. This shop  started 3 years ago . Joining in our credit program in 2003, she has used loans mostly for her raising. In this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for chickens and  a part of to buy hair care products
 Ms Hoa is 26 years old with 2 children.  She is raising chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 3,270,000 Vietnam dong  to buy food for chickens
  Ms Huyen is 27 years old with  2 children .  Her business focuses on selling and buying scrap products. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnam dong to buy more products for sale
  Ms Hang is 41 years old with 2 children. She is selling and buying scrap products . She wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to  invest in  her business
 Ms Huong is 41 years old with 2 children . She is scrap product sale person. She  wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy more products for sale.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and  a part of to buy hair care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support her fish selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  purchase more timber for sale.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Ms Lan  is 38 years old with two children who are grown-up.  She runs a small restaurant that serves breakfast.  

Her business started five years ago.  Joining in our credit program, she uses loans for her business.  For the new loan cycle, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,374,000 Vietnam dong to buy more furniture to improve her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more furniture to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Dzendere Karisa

texts.en:
Dzendere Karisa is a 70 year old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. She is married. She has been running her retail business for the past five years with great success. 

This is Dzendere’s first business loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more sugar, rice, tea leaves, cooking oil and cooking flour to sell in her retail shop. She will use the proceeds from her business to repay her loan. She hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, tea leaves, cooking oil and cooking flour to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 52 year old business man. He is married to Dorcas who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children aged 15, 11, 8 and 5 years. He has been in the livestock trading business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy more livestock for trading. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup vehicle for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy more livestock for trading.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a thirty-eight-years-old business woman married to Alloys, a mechanic. They have a 14-year-old son.

Grace has been selling  small fish locally known as Omena for the past 10 years. The loan applied for amounts to Kshs 20,000  and will be used to purchase two sacks of small fish for sale . 

Her monthly source of income is approximately Kshs 5,000. She plans to use part of her business profit to repay her loan as well as expand her fish business. Grace’s hopes and dreams are to have a big business and to send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to add stocks of small fish locally known as Omena.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai is 47-years-old with 3 children. Two of them are in high school and elementary school. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing vegetables and cherry blossoms for the Tet holiday. Participating in our credit program in 2004, she used a loan effectively for expanding her business. For the new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam dong to buy vegetables for growing and fertilizer.

Huyen is 28-years-old with 2 children. She is managing a small hair  salon. She wants to have a  loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy hair care products

Tho is 33-years-old with 2 children. She is  growing cheery blossoms, and rasing  pigs. She needs to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy food and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for growing and fertilizer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 31-years-old man living in Fort Portal Uganda in a semi permanent house. He has been driving a motorcycle for four years. With the income earned from driving, he has been able to provide basics to his family. His goals are educating his children, building a permanent house and buying land land to grow crops.

John needs the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a 56-years-old widowed woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 16 years to 29 years. She describes herself to be intelligent and principled. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, rice, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a viable place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the retail store. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy  more home products such as sugar, wheat flour, etc. Her business goal is to run a fully stocked retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more home products such as sugar, wheat flour, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tires.

loans.name: Mary Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mary Mwarabu is a 43-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. She is a married mother of four. She has been running her business for the past two years with great success. 

This is Mary’s first business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, and tea leaves. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah used the previous loan to buy rice, sugar, and soap. Her business capital has now grown from 3,000,000 UGX to 3,500,000 UGX. Her dream is to build a permanent house, educate her children, and buy a motorcycle. She now needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and soap for resale

loans.name: Mayen

texts.en:
Mayen is a 27-year-old, married woman with two children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Mayen is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 24 years old and married with children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda in a semi-permanent house. He has been in the transport sector for two years. His dream is buying a new motorcycle since he now rides for someone else who takes 70% of his daily earnings. He also has challenges of high fuel costs, and his family dream is to build a permanent house. Patrick needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and married to Anna. They have two children who are six and seven years old respectively. He does transportation with a motorbike and also sells charcoal. He has been in  these business for six years and right now his monthly income is KES 8,000.

He is borrowing his first loan of KES 20,000 which he intends to use to purchase charcoal for sale. He will pay back his loan with the anticipated profits from the business. 

His hope and dream is to purchase another motorbike and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old and married to Christopher, who brings some additional income to the family. They have four children of the following ages: 30, 25, 20, and 18 years respectively. She runs a salon, and she has been in the business for 16 years. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to expand her business by purchasing chemicals and weaves for sale. She will repay her loan with the anticipated profit.

loans.use: To purchase items to be used in a salon.

loans.name: Kihara Road Group

texts.en: Yoweri is a 60-year-old married man with seven children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been a farmer for 20 years, and his major hardship is the unpredictable seasonal weather changes. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include livestock farming. Yoweri needs the loan to buy cotton for planting.

loans.use: to buy cotton for planting.

loans.name: Anastasia Akinyi

texts.en:
Anastasia Akinyi is a 40-year-old fruits and vegetables seller in Bombolulu, Mombasa. She is a married mother of two. She has been in this business for the last four years, and she is doing great. 

This is her first business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more bananas, mangoes, and cabbages to resell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and add more stock to her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, mangoes, and cabbages.

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en: Rebbeca is a 55-year-old widowed lady with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children since the responsibility solely rests on her. She has been in the hardware business for the last 16 years after starting with 2,000,000 UGX in capital. Now she has 10,000,000 UGX as her working capital. Her major hardship is price fluctuation and inflation. She has a vision of buying land to grow crops and expanding her hardware shop. Rebbeca needs the loan to buy cement, poles, and ring beams for resale.

loans.use: to buy cement, poles, and ring beams

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old. He is married to Everline and they have six children of the following ages: 15, 10, 10, eight, six, and four years, respectively. 

He does motorbike repair and has been in business for seven years. Right now his monthly income is KES 10,000. 

He is taking out his first loan of KES 20,000, with which he wants to purchase 10 litres of oil and brake fluid. He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to boost his business by purchasing 10 litres of oil and brake fluid.

loans.name: Adheu

texts.en:
Adheu is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Adheu is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase milk and sugar for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase milk and sugar for sale

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a 25-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a photo studio for the last three years, after starting with a capital of 30,000 shillings, but now has 2.5 million shillings as his working capital. His major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock, however, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include crop production and expanding his business to new areas. Alfred needs the loan to buy a passport photo cutter.

loans.use: to buy a passport photo cutter

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mr. Chim, 41, is a married man who has been residing in Baray district. He is not working in a well-paid job; presently he operates a firewood-selling business. Everyday he has to collect the firewood from other places or buy in bulk from his frequent suppliers, then he takes them to sell through the commune and local markets by using a buffalo to haul his trailer. His wife also helps him in earning income through a micro pig-raising business. Mr. Chim has four single children who depend on his income. 

Recently Chim has hired some local construction laborers to fix some broken parts of his house. Chim now wants to acquire some funds to complement his existing capital to pay for the construction fees. He feels very happy to see his house completely repaired. He hopes that it’ll provide his family with a more comfortable place to live.

loans.use: to pay for construction fees

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 35-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been running a welding and spare parts business for the last ten years and his major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel and transportation costs, and inadequate capital to purchase stock, however, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets. Richard needs a loan to buy welding materials.

loans.use: to buy welding materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a single woman. She has a daughter who is 8 years old. She describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in a stragetic and busy place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. Within the next 5 years, Margaret's business goal is to venture into a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Jemimer Wambui

texts.en:
Jemimer Wambui is 29 years old.  She is married and the mother of one child.  She sells fruits and vegetables in Mombasa.  She has been running this business for the last five years and she is doing great. 

This is her first business loan from KADET.  She plans to purchase more bananas, mangoes, kale, tomatoes and oranges.  She will use the anticipated profit from this loan to educate her child and repay her loan.   She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, mangoes, kale, tomatoes and oranges.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль родилась в с. Кызыл-Туу в семье чабанов. Все детство Айгуль было связано в разведением скота, так как в сезон родители занимались выпасом  500-600 мелкого рогатого скота. Закончив курсы продавцов в столице, Айгуль начала работать продавцом в магазине. 2009 году Айгуль вышла замуж  и вместе с мужем Батыром в 2010 году вернулась в родное село. В первые годы переезда семья Айгуль испытала трудности, не было возможности расширить хозяйство, устроиться на работу, но со временем они  арендовали 1 га земли и занялись выращиваем картофеля. Затем, в качестве расширения бизнеса,  Айгуль начала заниматься животноводством, купив корову, начала продавать молоко. Прибыль от продажи составляет на сегодняшний день около 4,500 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнес – деятельности, Айгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в  сумме 50,0000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и кормов. Доходы Айгуль планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем – основать большую ферму.
texts.en: Aigul was born in the Kyzyl-Tuu village in the family of shepherds.  All of her childhood was closely tied with breeding livestock because her parents were involved in taking 500-600 small livestock to pasture during the season.  After finishing salespeople training in the capital, Aigul began to work as a salesperson at a store.  She got married in 2009 and, together with her husband, Batyr, returned to her native village in 2010.  During the initial years after the move, Aigul's family experienced difficulties, as they were unable to expand their business and get a job, but, with time, they leased a hectare of land and started to grow potatoes.  Then, to expand her business, Aigul became involved in animal husbandry by buying a cow and selling milk.  The profit from the sales amount to about 4,500 som (KGS) today.  In order to further expand her business, Aigul requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a cow and fodder.  She plans to invest the profits into increasing livestock headcount and to start a large farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Renel

texts.en: Renel has owned a engaged in farming business for eight years. He is married and has two adult children. Currently he provides for his family using the income gained from selling animals he has raised. Due to a lack of funds, he cannot develop his agricultural and farming efforts at the same time. Therefore, the purpose of the loan of P 40,000 is to buy seeds for planting in order to be a successful farmer. His future plans is to expand his business. Renel hopes that you will support him and thanks you in advance for this.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 30 years old.  He is married to Jacinta and they have been blessed with one child who is one year old.  He supports his family of three members by running a retail shop.  He has been in business for one year and, at the moment, his monthly income from the business is 15,000 KES.

A friend introduced Pius to KADET LTD.  He is borrowing his first loan in the amount of 20,000 KES.  With it, he intends to purchase 100 kilograms of sugar to sell.

loans.use: to increase his inventory by purchasing sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elcedita

texts.en: Elcedita lives together with her husband parents and children. She has been engaged in agriculture for already 12 years. Now Elcedita would like to develop her farm. With the help of the loan amounting P 30,000 she will purchase seeds, as well as fertilizer.  The children are growing, so are their needs. Elcedita wants to insure her family is fed and her children are educated. Development of agriculture will help Elcedita to implement these purposes.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Akuot

texts.en:
Akuot is 36 years old.  She is married and has two children, neither of whom attends school.  She operates a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan.  She has been in business for two years.

Akuot is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase beans, rice and onions.   She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice and onions to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman.  She has two children aged seven and 15 years.  She describes herself as flexible and patient.  She operates a retail business, selling dresses and suits and providing repair services.  She has been involved in this business for one year.  Her business is located in a very busy and viable place.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.  She will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy five rolls of cloth.  Mary's business goals are to own a boutique, to buy an additional sewing machine and to employ people within the next five years.

loans.use: To buy five rolls of cloth for making clothes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 39-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya.  He is married to Rose and together they have four children aged 10, 12, 14 and 16 years.

John sells music compact discs (CDs) and movie discs in Kisumu town.  He has operated this business for 11 years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy additional music CDs and movie discs to sell.  He plans to reinvest the anticipated profits in his business.

His dream is to have a big music store in Kisumu town in the future.

loans.use: to buy music and movie discs to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 58 years old and married and has five children. She farms poultry to earn a living. In addition, she grows vegetables for extra income. She is able to support her five children with the income from her business.

Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business. She thanks Faulu Kenya for training her on business management skills. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Kerambo Mwita

texts.en:
Kerambo Mwita is a 40-year-old grocery store owner in Mombasa. He is married and has been running this business for the past 10 years with great success. 

This is Kerambo’s first business loan from KADET. He hopes to purchase more tomatoes, onions and kale to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to build his own permanent house. He hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, onions and kale.

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Mr. Lor, 45, is a farmer who lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. He also sells firewood. He is a diligent and responsible father who works outdoors from dawn to dusk to support his three school-age children. He does this because he wants them to have an education and get good-paying jobs after they graduate. 

Mr. Lor would like borrow some funds from Kiva, through HKL, to buy a new plowing machine because his is old and often breaks. With his new plowing machine, he hopes that he won’t have any difficulties to perform his farming tasks as he has before.

loans.use: to buy a new plowing machine.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 39 years old and married to Mary, who is a business lady providing some income for the family. They have seven children. He runs a spare parts' shop and he has been in this business for 15 years. Right now his monthly income is KES 12,000.

He is borrowing his first loan of KES 20,000, which he intends to use to purchase more tires for sale. He will repay his loan with the anticipated profit.

loans.use: to boost his business by purchasing more tires for sale

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ajok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 39 years old, married and with three children.  To earn a living, she sells chips.  She employs one person in the business.  Besides chips, she also sells vegetables, onions and carrots. Esther has improved her business through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes for cooking chips.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for cooking chips

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is aged 64 and has been in active farming for 17 solid years. Her farm currently produces bananas, arrowroots, paw paw, maize and avocados which are all sold within the local market. Her farm is currently run with the help of two farmhands.

Magdaline had previously acquired two loans of 45,000 KES and 60,000 KES respectively, both of which were repaid promptly. She is currently requesting a loan of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to build a zero grazing unit for her dairy animals at 50,000 KES, and to improve her farming by installing an irrigation system in her farm for her banana plantation, which requires consistent irrigation. She will use the loan specifically to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. She says that finances are the farmer's main predicament; the high cost of labour and animal diseases are some pressing issues. She reiterates that the future is promising with Juhudi Kilimo loans together with the skills she has gathered in 17 years.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit and buy irrigation equipment

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a mother of six who lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is a dairy farmer. She began the business after purchasing cows and dairy goats. Nyevu learnt of Kiva partner Milango from her friends.

Nyevu is applying for a loan of 36,000 Kenya shillings in order to construct a crush and purchase two more cross breed dairy cows. Her main challenge is seasonal weather and some clients not paying on time. Nyevu hopes to build a larger herd of cattle in the future. She will save some of the extra income and apply for an additional loan in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to construct a crush and purchase two more cross breed dairy cows.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 23 year-old gentleman from Kisumu City and is married to Eunice, at the moment they don’t have any children.

Ben sells music and movie compact discs (CDs) in Kisumu town.  This is a business he has done for the last five years making a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He is borrowing his first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD which he will use to buy more music and movie CDs to sell. He will put back the anticipated profits into the business.

His dream is to have a big music store in the heart of Kisumu town.

loans.use: to buy music and movie discs to sell.

loans.name: Asha Kibwana

texts.en:
Asha Kibwana is a 39 year-old tailor in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is a divorced mother of four. She has been doing this business for the past six years and she is doing great. 

This is Asha’s first business loan from Kiva partner KADET. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a well known business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 44 year-old mixed crop farmer.  She is a single mother of three children aged 15,13 and 10 years respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with Kiva partner KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Sabina will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 47 years-old and married with three children.  To earn a living, he does tailoring.  He has been in the business for ten years and employs two people.  He also does farming for more income generation.

Through Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has managed to save his money and invest more for his business.

Reuben hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Katooke Kwekamba Group

texts.en: 38-year-old, hard-working George lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda with his two children. After failing to continue with school due to a lack of money for school fees, he decided to venture into produce buying and selling. He has been in this business for 17 years. His major challenge is price fluctuation and inflation, and his dream is to diversify and grow crops. George needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a farmer, a business she has done for three years. She also has three children. Mwenda was introduced to Milango by her friends. 

She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow. Mwenda faces the challenge of seasonal weather, especially during dry weather when there is little fodder for the animals, and some clients don't pay on time.

She looks forward to owning a milking farm and saving the extra income from this loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer, 30 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She has operated a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old businessman married to Jane, a businesswoman. They are blessed with three children. John has been selling cereals for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

John is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. John will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for his business. 

John will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for his grains.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer in Kitale and she has 5 solid years of experience in farming. She currently produces vegetables and onions for the local market. Grace works as a food vendor in the local market and her food is sold mainly at construction sites in the local town.

Grace has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and  insure a dairy cow. She says this will improve her farming income and enable her to take better care of her children's basic needs, especially their education. She hopes to scale up her farming business; however, she says that farmers are facing a great challenge occasioned by animal diseases and poor infrastructure.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new shaving machines

loans.name: Arok

texts.en: Arok, 45 years old, is married and has four children, three of them in school. She has operated a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years. Arok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. He is married to Elizabeth and they have four children aged between 3 and 10. For the last 10 years, Michael has operated a business selling music and movie compact discs (CDs) in Kisumu, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is taking out his first loan, which he will use to buy movies, blank compact discs and many other accessories. Michael will use the profits to open a business for his wife. His dream is to expand and have a big music store.

loans.use: To buy movie and music CDs for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been farming in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya, growing mainly cereals, and more specifically, maize and beans.

Grace has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry in order to venture into the poultry farming business. She claims there is a ready market for poultry products, especially birds. She says she will use the income to educate her children and venture into dairy farming as well. Grace hopes to have started dairy farming and have four dairy cows in five years' time.

Grace laments poor infrastructure as being the main challenge to farmers in the area as it delays delivery of produce to the market and is expensive as well.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Athou

texts.en:
Athou is a 40-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business selling at a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two year.
Athou is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar, and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Cristine Joy

texts.en: Cristine Joy is from the village of Zone II. She is 28 years old. Cristine Joy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Cristine Joy owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cristine Joy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately P 15,000 a month for these activities. Cristine Joy engage in grocery to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristine Joy requesting a loan of P 50,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional products like drinks, snack foods and coffee for her store

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 33, is a resident of Kitale and has 5 years of experience in active farming. He is married with two children both under four years old. His farm produce of maize and milk are sold at the local market.

Paul has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will provide his family with milk for consumption and for sale to meet other family basic needs. He hopes to have at least four dairy cows in five years.

Paul says their main challenge is in dealing with animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is a 35 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 13 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes being sold. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes. Fridah's business goal is to run a boutique in her town area within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Loicy

texts.en:
Loicy is a fifty-seven-year-old lady from Lambwe, a rural town in Western Kenya. Her husband is deceased and she has three grown-up children.

Loicy operates a tailoring business in Lambwe town, a business she has done for over 20 years and from which she makes a monthly income of Kes 40,000. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy new stock of clothing and also textile material for sewing new clothing. 

She plans to use the profits to build a retail shop. Her dream is to live a better and more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy textile material for tailoring and dressmaking.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el presente grupo fue una de las miembros, quien se motivo en la idea de ayudar a sus amigas por medio de del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ella invito a sus amigas y vecinas y de alli surgio el grupo llaSata Lucia.
La sra. Mirtha se dedica a la venta de leche esta acompañada con el Señor Nery hace 14 años quien trabaja como chofer, tienen dos hijos  que aun son muy pequeños y van a ala escuela. Ella nos comenta que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que debe llevar la leche que vende a las mesas de sus clientes para la hora del desayuno. Su meta es poder seguir creceindo para poder continuar ayudando a syu famila.
Mirtha solicita el crédito para la compra de taller, contenedores, y leche, para que de esa forma pueda trabajar mejor y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The contact for this group is one of the members; she was motivated by the idea of helping her friends through the Enterprising Women Program of the Fundación Paraguaya.  She invited her friends and neighbors to get together, and in this way the group called Santa Lucia was started.

Mirtha has a business selling milk, and her partner, Nery, has been working as a driver for 14 years.  They have 2 children who are very young and who go to school.  She tells us that she works from the very early hours of the morning, since she has to deliver the milk that she sells to the tables of her customers in time for breakfast.  Her goal is to be able to continue to grow her business so that she can continue to help her family.

Mirtha requests a loan to buy jars, containers and milk.  In this way, she will be able to work better and offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk, containers, jars, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional printed cloth).

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is from Ninotsminda, South Georgia. He is 34 years old, married, and lives with his family, wife Sashik, 9-year-old daughter, 7-year-old son, and mother. His children go to school. 

Armen and Sashik earn a living through agriculture as well as cheese production. They grow potatoes on a family-owned plot of the land. Also Armen purchases local cheese and processes it to get the traditional West Georgian cheese “sulguni”, which has higher price than local cheese. He sells it in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Armen requested credit for purchasing cheese for “sulguni” production. He will produce and sell more sulguni and increase the income of the family, which will be used for improving family members' living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase local cheese for West Georgian cheese production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pieces of bazin (damask cloth).

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 42 Group

texts.fr:
L e  groupe de crédit  Djiguène  Bakhna 42 regroupe cinq femmes qui font de la vente de fruits et légumes.
La  présidente madame Ngoné  exerce le commerce depuis 10 ans et son activité consiste à vendre des fruits et des légumes dans le marché local. Ngoné  arrive à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Dans l’avenir elle voudra avoir son propre magasin et être autonome.
texts.en: The group Djiguène Bakhna 42 is made up of five women who sell fruit and vegetables. The head of the group, Ngoné, has been in business for 10 years and she sells fruit and vegetables at the local market. She manages to provide for her family's needs. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and be independent.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional printed cloth).

loans.name: Tukorrehamu Kijweka United Group

texts.en: Kato is a thirty-year-old hardworking man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been dealing in the produce business for the last ten years and he got the initial capital after selling off his Irish potato garden. He has challenges with price flactuation and inflation and his dreams are to educate his children and to hire employees to help in expanding his business. Some of the members did not take a portion of the loan but because of the group's policy, they had to guarantee the others.

loans.use: to buy beans for sale

loans.name: Risbu

texts.ru: Рысбу родилась в южной Ошской области, в селе Кулча. В 1985 году, по окончании школы, она поступила в Медицинское училище в г.Кызыл-Кие. 1986 году, когда Рысбу окончила первый курс, ее украли замуж (старинная традиция «кражи невест» просуществовала долгое время, в настоящий момент преследуется по закону вплоть до уголовной ответственности).   Из-за замужества Рысбу пришлось бросить учебу и стать домохозяйкой. 1990 году у Рысбу родился старший сын Токтаалы, а в 1993 - родился младший сын Бегалы. В 2000 году Рысбу со своей семьей переехала в Чуйскую область (северная часть страны) в с.Ровное, где они сняли чабанский дом. Для семьи Рысбу начался трудный период - супруг не работал, после операции Рысбу стала инвалидом. В 2009 году, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, Рысбу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с покупки одной дойной коровы. На сегодня ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молочных продуктов составляет примерно 4,500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, Рысбу с мужем смогли приобрести подержанный автомобиль и супруг Рысбу начал предоставлять услуги такси. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рысбу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Это позволит ей увеличить продажи молока и повысить свою прибыль.  Доходы Рысбу хочет вложить в постройку дома для своей семьи.
texts.en: Risbu was born in the southern Osh region, in the Kulcha village.  In 1985, after finishing school, she was accepted to the Medical college in the city of Kyzyl-Kiya.  In 1986, when Risbu completed her first year of college, she was stolen to marry (an old tradition of "stealing brides" that has existed for a long time and is currently persecuted by law up to a criminal responsibility).  Because of the marriage, Risbu had to stop her education and become a housewife.  Her oldest son, Toktaaly, was born in 1990, and her youngest son, Begaly, was born in 1993.  In 2000, Risbu and her family moved to the Chuysk region (northern part of the country) to the Rovnoye village, where they rented a shepherd's house.  This is when a difficult period for Risbu's family began - her husband did not work, and Risbu became disabled after an operation.  In 2009, Risbu started her own animal husbandry business to provide a source of income for her family after purchasing one dairy cow.  Today, the monthly profit from sales of milk products amounts to about 4,500 som (KGS).  Thanks to hard work and persistence, Risbu and her husband were able to purchase a used car, and Risbu's husband began providing a taxi service.  In order to further develop her business, Risbu requested a loan in the sum of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a dairy cow.  This will allow her to increase milk sales and her profits.  Risbu plans to invest the profits into building a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur OUMAR est né vers 1972 à FARAKOBA. Père de 5 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à LOULOUNI (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 4ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs et du sorgho. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son  3 prêts maintenant, les deux prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 5 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de sorgho.
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de LOULOUNI. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin pendant un certain temps. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de SIKASSO et de BAMAKO et souvent il les transporte à SIKASSO au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste
texts.en:
Oumar was born around 1972 in Farakoba. He is the father of 5 children and lives in a traditional family at Loulouni (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

He has been in the grain business for more than four years. His experience in this area has given him a good reputation and he receives orders for grains, mainly corn and sorgum. He is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to obtain the resources he needs to satisfy his customers. 

This is Oumar's third loan, and he has repaid the first two loans successfully. This loan will enable him to buy 5 tonnes of corn and 1 tonne of sorgum. He buys supplies in the villages around Loulouni. The grains are stored in his shop for a while, then he resells them for cash to male and female customers from Sikasso and Bamako. Often he transports the grains to Sikasso if required. 

With this loan, he expects to earn 150,000 FCFA a month. This income will allow him to pay the interest on his loan and invest in his business. He wants to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cereal grain.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a single woman. She has 2 children aged 9 and 11 year. She describes herself as honest, outgoing, and God-fearing. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, potatoes, and onions. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more kale, onions, and potatoes. Her business goal is to run a fully-stocked grocery store within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more kale, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Adeeb

texts.en:
Adeeb is a 26-year-old man living in Taiz, Yemen. He completed secondary school but was not able to proceed further with his studies due to the difficult living conditions he faced.
Adeeb's business is a grocery store, which he started three years ago by working with others. He worked hard to raise money to establish the business as it was to be the starting point of his young life. Adeeb was able to gain many customers and he is now inspired to expand his capital and income by purchasing all the grocery items needed by members of his neighborhood. To do this, Adeeb has taken a youth loan of 100,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB for purchasing all the required grocery items. 
In the future, Adeeb hopes to expand his business by opening another store to sell gas cylinders.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary still runs a retail shop with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and rice for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will help her improve the living standards of her children.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar and rice to her shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 46-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children, aged 18 and 15 years respectively. She has been running a green grocer business for the past four years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Irene will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and continue with the grocery business.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy "atiéke" (semolina made from cassava)

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 37-year-old married woman with five children; two of the children are in school. She has had a business selling from a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachael is 47 years old. Rachael, a business lady, is married to Evan, who is employed. This couple is blessed with four children. She has been selling cereals for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

Rachael is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Rachael will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Everlyne
