texts.en: Everlyne is a 27 year old married woman. She has 2 children, ages ranging from 1 year to 6 years. She describes herself to be innovative and God-fearing. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables, such as tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located near a busy road. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of vegetables. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more vegetables, such as tomatoes. Her business goal is to run a stocked grocery store with all kinds of vegetables within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 32 years old, married, and has one child. Grace sells used shoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old, a business lady. She is married to Boniface who is employed. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling cereals for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Sarah will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing and sale of shea butter.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 25 year old married woman who has three children. One child is in school. Yar has a business of selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en:
Vagharshak lives in Akhalkalaki, in the Southern part of Georgia with his family: his wife Marina and two sons (16 and 12 years old). The family earns their living through agriculture. They grow potatoes on a family-owned plot of the land. They sell the potatoes locally to retailers. Vagharshak also has three bee-hives with bee-colonies. They sell gathered honey locally as well. The total average monthly income for the family is 650 Laris.

Vagharshak has requested credit to purchase potatoes for sowing. This year he will sow more potatoes and increase the income of the family. They will use increased income for purchasing additional household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 49 year old business lady. She is married to Francis, who is employed. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling cereals for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD., after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty se han unido con las ganas de poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las mujeres es la señora es Maria, quien se dedica a la cría de animales, como cerdos y gallinas. Comenta que trabaja todos los días cuidando  y criando a sus gallinas y cerdos, es un trabajo muy sacrificado y que necesita de mucho esfuerzo.  Su meta es poder tener una granja grande donde poder tener muchos animales que criar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lechones pequeños, pollitos, balanceados para estos y demás insumos necesarios para poder utilizar en la cría de los animales.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of Curuguaty have come together with the desire to work together, and through this work help each other.  They are currently in their first loan cycle with the Enterprising Women Program of the Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the women is Maria, who has a business raising animals such as pigs and hens.  She comments that she works every day caring for her animals and raising them.  This work demands a lot of effort and sacrifice.  Her goal is to have a big farm where she could have a lot of animals to raise.

She is requesting a loan to buy piglets and chicks, and to buy nutritionally balanced feed for them and other supplies that she needs to use in raising the animals.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chicks, and to buy nutritionally balanced feed for them and other supplies

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is 29 years old, a married woman with four children. Two of the children are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru:
Аиде 27 лет, не  замужем, проживает с родителями в селе Петровка.
Аида родилась в Ошской области (юг страны)  в семье фермера и с малых лет вместе с родителями занималась выращиванием овощей,  фруктов, которые  они реализовывали на местном рынке, параллельно они содержали хозяйство: бычков на откорме, овец, коз, что являлось основным доходом в семье. 
Аида в 2001 году окончила среднюю школу, поступила учиться на швею, окончив учебу, два года проработала  в швейном цехе «Ак-Куу».  Со временем ее близкие родственники стали переезжать в Чуйскую область (северная часть). Причина переезда  связана с тем, что  в сельской местности, где они проживали, земельная доля выделенная на  одного члена семьи очень маленькая -  земельный надел  одной семьи составляет 6-10 соток, что не позволяет  получить планируемый урожай.  А сельскохозяйственный урожай  - это основной доход в сельской местности, производство и промышленность не развита.
В 2005 году семья Аиды переехала в Чуйскую область,  село Петровка, где проживают по настоящее время. Переехав  в новый край, семья испытала немало трудностей – проживая на съемной квартире, они занимались полеводством,  выращиванием арбузов, перца, помидоров. Через два года,  семья Аиды смогла купить себе дом. На сегодняшний день,  Аида занимается животноводством - содержит две коровы и  сдает молоко производителям молочной продукции, что приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Аида обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Аида планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aida is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the village of Petrovka. She was born in the Osh region (south of Kyrgyzstan) in a farming family, and from the early years was involved in growing fruit and vegetables that were then sold at the local market. At the same time the family raised calves, sheep and goats for sale, and this constituted their main source of income.

In 2001, Aida graduated from hight school and began to study for a job as a seamstress. Upon completing her studies, she worked for two years in the "Ak-Kuu" sewing factory. Over time, her close relatives began relocating to the Chuisk region in the north of the country. This was caused by the fact that in the area where they had lived, very little land was allocated per family member - a family would have 6-10 hundredths of a hectare (roughly one quarter of an acre), which didn't allow to produce sufficient harvest. Meanwhile, agriculture was the main source of income in the countryside where manufacturing and industry were not developed.

In 2005, Aida's family moved to the village of Petrovka in the Chuisk region, where they live to this day. Having moved to this new location, the family experienced many difficulties - living in a rented apartment, they engaged in farming, cultivating watermelons, peppers and tomatoes. After two years, Aida's family could finally buy a house. Today, Aida is engaged in raising cattle - she keeps two cows and sells the milk to producers of dairy products, which brings her around 10,000 som per month. In order to expand her business, Aida has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase more cattle. Aida plans to use her revenues to repair the house.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is a mother of 3 children, aged between 11 and 16 years, all in schooling. She has been in farming for 3 years and produces mainly eggs, vegetables and maize for the local market. She is aged 32.

Moureen has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional dairy cow will generate her more income, which she intends to use in improving her children's living standards. She aspires to have four dairy cows in five years.

She reiterates the challenge in farming remains the high costs of managing animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be innovative and caring. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as tomatoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located near a busy road. 

Salome describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of vegetables. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more vegetables such as tomatoes. Her business goal is to run a stocked grocery store, with all kinds of vegetables, within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shea nuts

loans.name: Itidal

texts.en:
Itidal is a 44-year-old hardworking woman. She is married to a man who works at Aqaba port, and they have five children.
To provide their children with the best environment to grow, Itidal chose to have her own business making cheese and yogurt. She first started at home then, step by step, she was able to open her own store and buy the needed tools and equipment to speed up the process of manufacturing the cheese and yogurt. Recently she expanded her store and made a new section for selling a few kinds of food products.
Now Itidal has applied for a loan in order to buy more food products for her store and more ingredients for making cheese and yogurt.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making cheese and yogurt plus food items for her store.

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en:
Shatha is 20 years old and the oldest sister in her family. She is an accounting student at Al Balqaa University and is in her freshman year for her bachelor degree. She hopes to continue to get a higher degree. 
Shatha has a brother, Saif Aldeen, who is 19 years old. He applied to college to major in crime studies. He is in his third year now and hoping that he will be able to find a job in his field.
Shatha has applied for a youth loan to pay for her semester fees and her brother’s. As she is a conservative person, she asked her brother Saif Aldeen to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to pay for her and her brother's semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly printed West African clothing) of the wax type.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Dafroza, is in her late twenties and is married. She has been running a grocery for six months now. She works from 10am to 11pm and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Dafroza’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to add stock of drinks to her grocery.  Dafroza’s dream is to, one day, build her own house.

Dafroza will share this loan with her loan group, "Wega", which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add stocks of drinks to her grocery.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en: Suha is a 34-year-old housewife who has three children. For four years Suha has been working as a hair stylist at home where she has some of the equipment that a beauty salon would have. Now Suha want to buy new hairdryers and other equipment in order to prepare to open a bigger beauty salon that is separate from her house. For this reason, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy new hairdryers and other equipment.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has been active in farming for 4 years. She is married and has 3 children, all under eight years old. Her farm produce of eggs and maize go to the local market in her hometown of Kitale, in Western Kenya.

Violet has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from JuhudI Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the improvement in her farming income will enable her to make her family members lives better. With additional milk for family consumption, the improved farming will also provide money to add more pressing basic needs.

Violet remains optimistic with the farming business, owing to the experience she has since acquired. She, however, points out that animal diseases remain the major challenge to the gains of farming, especially dairy.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Caacupé Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Caacupé, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Evangelista. Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo  ciclo, con once  integrantes, han demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras.    Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas, y de escasos recursos, por lo que reciben muy pocas intenciones y beneficios y es por ello que agradecen a la fundación por la oportunidad que les da.
La señora Evangelista se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y demás, con lo cual ha podido crecer y por medio de eso ayudar a sus familiares. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando en la economía de la casa y mantener el hogar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y demás tipos de bebidas para poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Caacupé” committee formed thanks to the initiative of Evangelista.  They are currently in the second cycle with 11 members.  They have shown unity and mutual support among the group members.   They are all self-sacrificing women of scarce resources who receive very few benefits and intentions and this is why they are grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it gives them.

Evangelista sells all types of beverages like beer, wine, soft-drinks and others that have allowed her to grow and help her family.  Her wish is to be able to continue to grow continuing to help her house’s economy and support her home.

She wants the loan to buy soft-drinks, beer, wine and other types of beverages to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy wine, beer, soft-drinks and other types of beverages.

loans.name: Lou

texts.en:
Lou is a 40 year old married woman. She has four children, all of them in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Lou is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shea nuts.

loans.name: Djiguéne Bakhna 34 Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna  n°34 regroupe 5 femmes habitant la même localité .Elles s’activent dans la vente de  légumes.
La présidente, Fatou avec une expérience de dix ans  achète la marchandise dans  la localité pour aller  la revendre dans la capitale. Elle appui son mari dans la dépense quotidienne  de la famille .Fatou  a comme  vœux dans  l’avenir, d’ouvrir un magasin pour concentrer son activité vers sa zone.
texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna No. 34 group comprises five women who live in the same area. They are active in the sale of vegetables.
The president, Fatou, has ten years of experience in this field and buys her goods in the area and re-sells them in the capital. She supports her husband in providing for the family's daily expenses. Fatou's hope in the future is to open a store to centralize her business in her area.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale in the capital.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a thirty two year old married man, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda with his three children. For seven years he has been operating a retail shop and this has enabled him to educate his children. Customers not paying on time is his major challenge and his dream is to expand the business to new areas. William needs the loan facility to buy salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt and sugar for sell.

loans.name: Houriya

texts.en:
Houriya is a 50-year-old married lady who has six sons and daughters, three of whom have jobs now.
Houriya has a small home workshop for tailoring. She has been working for a while now using an old sewing machine. Now that she has more orders for sewing and tailoring clothes, Houriya has found that she needs to upgrade her machine and buy more tools to speed up her work. Therefore, Houriya has applied for a loan in order to buy a new electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has 2 children, ranging in age from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be kind, honest and God-fearing. She operates a school where she provides education. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a highly populated area and her primary customers are the resident's children. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of ingredients of food used to cook food for the children. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to construct more classes. Her business goal is to run a primary school with over eight hundred children within 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of the classes.

loans.name: Issifou

texts.fr:
Monsieur ISSIFOU est né vers 1969 à Gningoni Cercle de Sikasso. Père de 5 enfants il vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Noumousso - Kadiolo (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Il mène les activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis trois ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, il y’a 5 cycles maintenant, les prêts passés ont été correctement dénoués.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 4 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de mil . Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Kadiolo. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de SIKASSO et de BAMAKO. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Issifou was born around 1969 in the Gningoni Cercle area of Sikasso. A father of five children, he lives in a nuclear family in the Noumousso area of Kadiolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
He has run a business selling cereals for three years. His experience in this field has earned him a good reputation, and he receives orders for cereals, especially maize. In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy his customers, he has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through five loan cycles so far, with all the previous loans having been repaid properly.
This loan will allow him to buy 4 tonnes of maize and 1 tonne of millet. He gets his supplies in the towns surrounding Kadiolo. The cereals are stocked at his store. He re-sells them in cash to a clientele composed of men and women from Sikasso and Bamako.
With this loan, he foresees earning a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to repay the interest on his loan and reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 46-year-old housewife who started a small home-based business with her husband selling slippers and shoes. Her husband buys the footwear at wholesale prices. 
Now Raeda has applied for the loan in order to buy more shoes so they can expand and open a small shop separate from their home.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to open a small shop.

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer is a 28 year old married woman who has four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akeer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a thirty four year old married man with eight children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for one year, despite the challenges of limited capital to meet the high demands. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business dream is a wholesale shop. Charles needs the loan facility to buy soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur BOUBACAR est né vers 1975 à LOULOUNI cercle de KADIOLO. Père d’un enfant, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à LOULOUNI ville (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Il mène les activités de boucherie depuis 20 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation si bien qu’il reçoit des commandes et vend chaque jour. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il vient de solliciter son quatrième prêt auprès de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  2 boeufs et 6 petits ruminants. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de certains villages voisins de la ville LOULOUNI et au Burkina Faso. Il les abats et revend au comptant dans la ville de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 72 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte avoir un parc de bétail uniquement préservé à l’abatage pour éviter la pénurie pendant les périodes de disette.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar was born around 1975 in Loulouni, near Kadiolo. A father of one child, he lives in a traditional household in the city of Loulouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
He has run a business as a butcher for 20 years. His experience in this field has earned him such a good reputation that he receives and fulfills orders every day. In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy his customers, he has just requested his fourth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, all his previous loans having been repaid properly.
This loan will allow him to buy two steers and six small ruminants. He gets his supplies at the markets in certain towns around the city of Loulouni and in Burkina Faso. He slaughters them and sells the meat in cash in the city of Loulouni to a clientele composed of men and women.
With this loan, he foresees earning an average monthly profit of 72,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to resolve most of his expenses, repay the interest on his loan, and invest the remainder in his business.
He hopes to have a dedicated livestock yard to avoid shortages during lean times.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Haniya

texts.en:
Haniya is a 47-year-old housewife. Working from home, Haniya has been fixing the edges of special men’s covers called “Shmagh”, by adding small balls made of wool. She also does embroidery on women’s scarves, head covers and dresses. It has been two years since she started officially and by doing this work she has been able to help improve her family's living standards.
Now Haniya has applied for a loan to buy more wool and other material to accessorize dresses.

loans.use: to buy more wool and other material to accessorize dresses.

loans.name: Allakan Soutra Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe ALLAKAN SOUTRA sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MILLION KIN, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de LOULOUNI. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures se sont bien dénoués.
MARIAM 1ère à droite sur la photo fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires dans ce groupe de femmes ALLAKAN SOUTRA, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  25kg de sel gemme, 2 cartons de cube magie, 1 bidon de 20 litres,  3 paquets de l’ail. Elle s’approvisionne à LOULOUNI les jours de foires et à Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend en détail, dans sa famille et les jours de foires au marché de la ville de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant souvent à crédit . 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The four members of the ALLAKAN SOUTRA group are married women who are on average 34 years old and have three children each.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Million Kin, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Loulouni.  In order to meet their customers' needs, the members of the group are requesting a third loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution.  Previous loans were properly repaid.  Mariam, the first woman from the right in the photo, sells condiments.  She is quite well-known in her field and is a very popular seller.  She plans to use this loan to buy 25 kilos of rock salt, 2 boxes of Maggi cubes, one twenty-liter container and 3 packets of garlic.  She buys her supplies in Sikasso and in Loulouni on market days.  She sells her merchandise for retail to her family and at the Loulouni market, on market days.  Her customers are mostly women who pay her in cash, often on credit.  Mariam is expecting average monthly profits to reach 31,250 CFA francs, part of which will be used to pay off her loan and the interests, while the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Areen

texts.en:
Areen is a 21-year-old single lady. She is the eldest of her four brothers and sisters.
Areen is a cheerful person who loves to play with children and has her own way of dealing with them. Following her love and passion for children, she has registered to study at university to become an official specialist in working with children in kindergarten. 
Today, Areen has applied for a loan to pay her semester’s fees so she can graduate and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to pay her semester’s fees.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a married woman. She has a son who is three years old. She describes herself as kind, honest, and God fearing. She operates a grocery store where she sells oranges, onions, potatoes, carrots, kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located along a busy road, and her primary customers are new and repeat. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of vegetables and fruits. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Julia's  business goal is to venture into and run a big supermarket within five years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Djiguéne Bakhna 38 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna  n°38 compte cinq membres  qui font du petit commerce .Leur activité consiste à vendre des fruits (orange, mandarine…) Elles habitent dans la même maison. 
La présidente Ndèye Ndoumbé  à une expérience de dix ans dans ce domaine .Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne  de son  foyer. Elle aimerait dans  l’avenir refinancer son bénéfice dans son activité  pour avoir une bonne assise.
texts.en:
Djiguène Bakhna n°38 Group comprises five members who are retailers. Their businesses consist in selling fruits (oranges, mandarins, etc). They live in the same house.

The group's president, Ndèye Ndoumbé, has ten years of experience in this field. She helps to cover the daily expenses of her household. In the future, she would like to reinvest her profit in her business, to give it a strong basis.

loans.use: to buy and resell fruits

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a 31-year-old married lady. Her husband works in the military, and Sharifa has a small grocery store in an outside room of her home. She has been running the store for the last five years, and during these five years she has been able to expand the store’s space and add more variety to the products she sells.
Now Sharifa has applied for a loan to purchase more products and move to a new location separate from her home.

loans.use: to purchase more products and move to a new location.

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe JEKAFO sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les cinq prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
KANDIA debout 2ème à droite sur la photo fait le commerce de pagnes wax et tissus dans ce groupe de femmes JEKAFO. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une dizaine de pièces et 10kg de tissus draps de lit. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et souvent au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la  ville  de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of JEKAFO Group are essentially married women, who average 34 years of age and two children. Most of them live in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a working class neighborhood in Sikasso.

They are seeking their sixth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. The previous five loans were repaid without problems.

KANDIA (second one standing from the right in the photograph) is a member of JEKAFO Group who sells "pagnes wax" (colorful African cloth). She intends to use her loan to buy about ten pieces of pagnes, and 10kg of bed sheet fabric.

She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso, and often at the Grand Market in Sikasso. She resells for cash, as a traveling saleswoman, in the various neighborhoods of Sikasso, as well as at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 22'000 (ca US$ 42), to be used in part to repay the loan and interests, and in part for savings. She ambitions to increase her revenue to better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: to buy about ten pieces of pagnes (colorful African cloth) and 10kg of bed sheet fabric.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
Haifa is a 22-year-old lady who is married to a young lawyer. She is a student at the university majoring in statistics. She is now in her last semester to gain her bachelors degree. Her husband is encouraging her to continue her studies to get a masters degree in her major.
With the support of her husband, Haifaa has decided to finish school and register for higher studies. She has applied for a loan in order to pay her last semester's fees so she can graduate and get her bachelors degree.

loans.use: to pay her last semester's fees.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Nueva Esperanza" ha culminado el 2do ciclo sin ningún tipo de inconvenientes por lo que han decidido avanzar  al tercer ciclo, contando actualmente con quince  integrantes.  Al igual que los demás comités, las integrantes son mujeres muy sacrificadas, y de escasos recursos, con muy pocas oportunidades de trabajar, pero gracias al apoyo que le está brindando la Fundación, a través de las capacitaciones, han logrado aumentar sus ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la señora Elvira, quien se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y es gracias a este trabajo que ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa. Ella nos dice que  su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir manteniendo a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, y de esa forma poder estar abastecida para poder tener más stock para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) committee has finished its second cycle problem-free so has decided to advance to the third cycle currently with 15 members.  Like the other committees, the members are very self-sacrificing women of scarce resources with few opportunities for work.  But thanks to support from the Fundación through the training they’ve managed to increase their income thus helping their families.

One of the group members is Elvira who sells pork.  Thanks to this work she’s been able to help her family cover expenses that arise daily at home.  She tells us that her goal is to continue working in order to continue to support her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy pork to have better stock to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy pork to resell.

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en: Yadigar is a tiler who works at a construction firm. Now the company he is working for is building houses for internally displaced people who've been displaced after war. He's worked for this company for about seven years. In the future he plans to open his own concrete production business to create stone slabs for foundations. Yadigar needs in 1200 AZN to rebuild his house after a fire and buy some household appliances.

loans.use: to rebuild his house after a fire and buy some household appliances.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 24-year-old single woman. She is a Lebanese girl who is living with her family in Jordan.
Sarah has registered at one of the Jordanian colleges to get her diploma degree in accounting information systems. She is now in her last year. She has applied for a loan to pay her semester fees. She then wants to register for another two years to get a bachelors degree.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Nyanduk

texts.en:
Nyanduk is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Nyanduk is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 27-year-old man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has a university degree but he could not get a job so he opened a grocery store. He started his business with limited capital and income. Because he is alone and has no one to support him, he did his best to improve and expand his business in order to build his future.
Due to the current bad situation which Yemen faces, Marwan's business is making less profit and his customers are decreasing. Therefore, he is planning to bring new goods to his grocery store in order to keep his customers and improve his income.
Marwan has requested a youth loan of 150,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB in order to purchase goods such as biscuits, cakes, soft drinks, rice and canned foods. He hopes that this will enable him to continue running his business successfully and make the business more profitable. 
In the future, Marwan would like to get a job and get married.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 45-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from seven years to 21 years. He describes himself as honest, God fearing, and innovative. He operates a car and provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located at a murram road, and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits for a new grocery store. Moses's business goal is to own many cars to increase his modes of transportation within five years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for a new grocery store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 57 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married and a mother of three children. She has been in the farming business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to buy seedling and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedling and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Pamellah

texts.en:
Pamellah is 36 years old, married and has four children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living and has been in this business for three years. Pamellah describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 
Since Pamellah joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her business and she hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 95,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 38 years old and a single mother of one child aged 20. She is a mixed crop farmer who has been rearing chickens for the past three years. She makes a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.
Ann is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Ann will use the loan to buy chicken feed and more chicks. 
With the anticipated profit from the business, Ann will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help her improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and more chicks.

loans.name: Nyanon

texts.en:
Nyanon is a 40-year-old married woman who has three children, all of whom have been to school. She has a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan, and has run this business for three years.
Nyanon is requesting a loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of food.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a married man with three children aged between 9 and 13. He describes himself as patient, God-fearing and determined. 
Jonathan operates a business where he provides motor vehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a populated area and his customers are both new and repeat. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying spare parts. He will use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy motor vehicles spare parts. 
Jonathan also runs a grocery store. His business goal is to venture into providing transportation services within five years.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is married and has one child. She runs a salon in Likoni, Kenya, and has had this business for three years. She began the business from her own savings.
Everline is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase weaves and hair shampoos. Despite the high cost of stock and some customers not paying on time, Everline intends to open more salons in the future. She intends to save the extra income from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase weaves and hair shampoos.

loans.name: San Blás Group

texts.es:
El grupo es San Blás se ha formado con la unión de 10 mujeres de una de las compañías más alejadas de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Ya que les es muy difícil llegar hasta la ciudad, la fundación paraguaya se ha acercado hasta ellas para poder ofrecerles la oportunidad de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudarlas a salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Maria, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de verduras, como ser cebollas, tomates, locotes, zapallos y demás tipos de verduras. Cuenta que ella misma se encarga de las ventas y de esa forma y con mucho esfuerzo puede ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de kiva para poder comprar tomates, locotes, cebollas, hortalizas y demás tipos de verduras con las cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma tener productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Blas” group has ten women members from one of the most distant communities from the city of Curuguaty.  Because it’s so difficult for them to come to the city, Fundación Paraguaya has gone to them to offer them the opportunity to get ahead and to help them get ahead.

One of the members is María who tells us that she is a vegetable merchant.  She sells onions, tomatoes, peppers, pumpkins and other types of vegetables.  She relates that she herself is the seller and with much effort is able to help her family cover daily expenses that arise.

She is asking Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for help to be able to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, leafy green vegetables and other types of vegetables to stock up and have products available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Edith

texts.es:
Luz Edith es una persona trabajadora que siempre ha querido apoyar a su esposo en la generación de ingresos para su hogar. La principal razón es porque tienen 2 hijos a los cuales les quieren brindar la mejor educación posible y un futuro económico estable. Debido a que Luz Edith no proviene de una familia con grandes ingresos, ha trabajado fuertemente gran parte de su vida para ir cumpliendo poco a poco sus sueños. Luz Edith no quiere que sus hijos tengan que pasar por las mismas circunstancias y por ello les quiere brindar la mejor educación posible para que puedan trabajar en una actividad que les genere mejores ingresos que los que pueden generar ella y su esposo. 
Luz Edith a sus 39 años labora en casas de familia cercanas, y como actividad independiente quiere comprar un cerdo que le pueda dar crías, y luego vender las crías para que así le genere ingresos en un futuro. Como Luz Edith no tiene grandes ingresos, y su esposo tampoco tiene gran capacidad económica, Luz Edith está en busca de un préstamo que le permita comprar el cerdo y el cuido de los primeros días. Luz Edith manifiesta que con esta oportunidad de comprar el cerdo y generar ingresos extras en un futuro, su vida y la de sus hijos y esposo mejorará enormemente.
texts.en:
Luz Edith is a hardworking person who has always wanted to help her husband generate household income.  The main reason is because they have two children that they want to provide the best possible education for and a stable future.  Because Luz Edith comes from a family with few resources she’s worked hard most of her life to gradually reach her dreams.  Luz Edith does not want her children to have to go through the same circumstances and that’s why she wants to give them the best possible education so that they will be able to work at something that will generate better income than what she and her husband are able to earn.

Luz Edith, at the age of 39, works in nearby families’ houses and as an independent activity wants to buy a sow that can produce piglets for her to then sell and generate income in the future.  Since Luz Edith does not earn much money and her husband doesn’t either, she’s seeking a loan that will allow her to buy the pig and feed for the first few days.  Luz Edith states that with this opportunity to buy a pig and generate extra income in the future her life as well as her children’s and her husband’s will improve enormously.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig and sell the litters in the future.

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en:
Fidelis is 39 years old. She is a farmer, and is married to David who is a business man. They are blessed with one child aged ten. She has been rearing poultry for the past two years which gives her a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Fidelis will use the loan to buy chicken feed and more chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and more chicks.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 54 years old a mixed crop farmer, and the single mother of one child. She has been in the farming business for the past three years and makes a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has six children whose ages range from eight to twenty-five. He describes himself as determined, patient and friendly. 

He operates a Nissan garage where he provides motorvehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for fifteen years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as being having insufficient funds to buy spare parts. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare wheels for motor vehicles. His business goal is to run a car rental company providing transportation; he hopes to do this within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy spare wheels for motor vehicles.

loans.name: Natalia Marcela

texts.es:
Emprendedora es la mejor palabra para describir a Natalia Marcela, una joven que a sus 22 años de edad ya quiere recibir el trabajo de la elaboración y venta de obleas que es de tradición familiar. Los padres de Natalia Marcela no obtienen grandes ingresos, por lo que Natalia Marcela ha visto grandes dificultades para poder cumplir el sueño de estudiar una carrera de educación universitaria, y es por esto que Natalia Marcela desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando como pulidora de algunas confecciones, sin embargo el pago es muy bajo y no le alcanza para cubrir sus gastos personales y ahorrar para sus estudios. Con el ánimo de colaborar con los gastos del hogar a sus padres, de pagarse sus propios gastos y de ahorrar para poder estudiar en un futuro, Natalia Marcela quiere que el negocio de la elaboración y venta de obleas se expanda y genere mayores ingresos, en gran parte porque el negocio es tan pequeño que no puede atender los pedidos de todos los clientes, es por esto que Natalia Marcela busca un préstamo que le permita comprar nuevas planchas para la elaboración de las obleas y la compra de insumos al por mayor que le permitan comprarlos a un menor precio.
Natalia Marcela manifiesta que con el incremento de la capacidad productiva del negocio sus ventas incrementarán y sus ingresos también lo harán, y de esta manera podrá mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus padres, y podrá cumplir su sueño de estudiar una carrera de educación universitaria que tanto ha anhelado.
texts.en:
“Entrepreneur” is the best word to describe Natalia Marcela, a 22-year-old woman.  She wants to go into the manufacture and sale of “obleas” [A variation of wafer, usually eaten as a dessert with two pieces filled with arequipe, dulce de leche (milk caramel) and/or sweetened condensed milk in the middle.  In some places they might contain cheese, fruits, Chantilly cream, among others. They are usually very popular as they are very inexpensive] since this is her family’s tradition.  

Natalia Marcela’s parents do not earn high income which is why Natalia Marcela has faced great difficulties in reaching her dream of studying a university career and this is why Natalia Marcela has been working for some time now polishing confections.  However, her salary is very low and does not suffice to cover her personal expenses or to save up for her studies.  

Wishing to contribute to her parents’ household expenses, to pay her own expenses and to save up for future studies, Natalia Marcela wants her oblea manufacturing and sales business to expand and generate higher income to a large extent because the business is so small that she’s unable to fill all her customer orders.  Because of this, Natalia Marcela seeks a loan that will allow her to buy new presses to make obleas and to buy ingredients at wholesale so that she can get them at better prices.

Natalia Marcela states that with an increase in production capacity of her business sales will increase and so will her income thus being able to improve her parents’ quality of life and be able to reach her dream of studying the university career she’s so much wished for.

loans.use: to buy a pastry press and ingredients in quantity.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a dairy farmer who resides in Malindi, Kenya. She has six children and has been rearing animals for six years. She started off by keeping one cow and has kept adding additional stock. 

Agnes is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more milking cows and to construct a cattle crush. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and the fact that some customers do not pay on time.

Agnes looks forward to opening a ranch and will save the extra income obtained from the loan.

loans.use: To buy more milking cows and to construct a cattle crush.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from eight to 15 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing and patient. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a strategic place, and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Florence's business goal is to venture into a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married businessman who lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He owns a grocery business which has been in operation for ten years. He began by selling vegetables in small quantities and has seen his business grow to the level of being able to stock cereals. Besides this business, Charles also does tailoring.

Charles was introduced to Milango by his friends and is currently applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more cereals, and to repair his sewing machine.

He has the vision of opening up a wholesale store, and intends to open other businesses from the extra income obtained from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals and to repair his sewing machine.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Ms Phuong is 19 years old with one small child. She is managing a small wood workshop that makes household furiniture. Her business started two years ago. Through a neighbour, she learned about SEDA's micro credit program. For her first new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 Vietnam dong to buy wood as material.

Ms Hang is 38 years old. She is raising chickens and pigs. She wants to have a loan of 7,840,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy wood as material

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is a single business man who resides in Malindi, Kenya. He has been involved in the transport business for one year. He used to hire a motorcycle to earn some income while transporting customers and their goods; a thriving business in Malindi especially in the rural areas which have a poor road network.

After learning about Milango, Sylvester joined the organization in order to access credit. He is now applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorcycle. 

Sylvester’s ambition is to buy more motorcycles, and will use the extra income to maintain the business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman.  She has two children with ages ranging from one year to fifteen years.  She describes herself to be outgoing and innovative.

Alice operates a grocery store where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for six months. Her business is located in a strategic developing area and her primary customers are residents of this area.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of fruit and vegetables.  

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruit and vegetables.  Within the next five years, Alice's business goal is to venture into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables for her grocery store.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 38 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a butcher and runs a small shop that sells fresh pork. Her business started two years ago. In 2008, she focused on raising chickens, but this business did not create enough benefit. For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,184,000 VND to buy pigs as fresh products for sale.

loans.use: to buy pigs as fresh products for sale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 33 year old married woman.  She has three children with ages ranging from three years to thirteen years.  She describes herself to be God-fearing and generous.  

Miriam operates a restaurant where she sells food and tea.  She has been involved in this business for seven years.  Her business is located in a fast growing area and her primary customers are masons.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of ingredients used for preparing food.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food.  Her business goal is to run a well furnished hotel within five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Faride Anahi

texts.es: La Señorita Faride tiene  como actividad principal la elaboración de collares, pulseras y canastones artesanales los vende en la feria 16 de julio  de la ciudad de el Alto y también por la zona de la ceja de el Alto , el credito que solicita es para poner madera en el piso de uno d elos ambientes de su casa ya necesita un ambiente mas grande para  trasladar su taller ya que a la mucha demanda que tiene  su taller le quede pequeño, el domicilio de Faride  en la zona Ciudad Satélite , actualmente vive con sus tres hermanos y su mama, a quienes ayuda con  los gastos del hogar, es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida por el apoyo que le brindan ya que esta es la unica actividda que le permite manter a su familia.
texts.en: Faride’s main activity is manufacturing necklaces, bracelets and artisanal baskets that she then sells at the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio street market and also in El Alto’s La Ceja zone.  She needs the loan to install a wood floor in one of the rooms in her house because she needs a larger space to move her shop into because demand is high and her workshop is too small.  Faride lives in Ciudad Satélite with her three siblings and her mother that she helps with household expenses.   She’s a very responsible, hardworking young woman who feels happy and grateful for the support she’s being given since this is the only activity she has that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: to install a wood floor.

loans.name: Ilsia Evelyn

texts.es:
Ilsia, de nuevo solicita un préstamo por la necesidad de invirtir en su negocio de tortillas y comprar la materia prima que necesita como: maíz, gas, leña, ya que hoy en dia a parte de la sastreria se dedica a vender tortillas, este oficio lo ha iniciado hace poco, porque es una manera de intentar ganar mas dinero, también ella quiere terminar una fosa de aguas negras y comprar cañería, cemento, arena, para finalizar la construccion y a si podrá vivir en mejores condiciones de vida.
Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron porque hizo algunas compras de materiales para la sastreria, dando un mejor servicio a los clientes y las condiciones de vida de su familia mejoraron.
texts.en: Ilsia is once again asking for a loan to invest in her tortilla business and to buy the raw materials she needs like: corn, gas and firewood since she now uses part of the tailor shop to sell tortillas.  She started this business a short time go because it’s a way to generate extra income and she also wants to finish building a septic tank and to buy tubing, cement and sand to finish building it to live in better conditions.  Previous loans helped her because she bought some supplies for her tailor shop thus providing better customers service and her family’s living conditions improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Ms Dung is thirty years old with two children who are of school age.  Being a farmer, she is dedicated to raising pigs.  After she has finished her farming activities, she works as an employed worker for some woodwork shop or for somebody who needs help with chores.  

Having joined the credit program in 2008, she has used her previous loans to expand her pig raising business.  Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is married and has six children.  Ernestina operates a grocery shop at Asebu Ekroful, Ghana, which she has done for three years.  Her husband is a pensioner.  Ernestina uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. 

Ernestina will use the loan to buy more groceries to offer her customers more variety.  With the new profits from her business, Ernestina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store to bring more variety to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm kennel to produce kennel oil to sell.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is 52 years old and has three adult children. She is a farmer who grows rice and raises pigs for meat. Tu joined this credit program in 2008 and has used her previous loans effectively to expanding her business and construct a sty. 

Tu is requesting an 8,288,000 VND loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Kaapoty Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Ka'apoty, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las señoras, quien se acerco hasta la oficina de la fundación para poder interiorizarse más acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con 16 integrantes.
Mirian es una de las integrantes de este grupo y nos cuenta que por medio de las manualidades que ella hace, ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es una mujer muy ingeniosa y creativa y gracias a esas dotes que tiene logra hacer muy buenas manualidades que se venden muy bien.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva, para poder continuar con su trabajo y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando. Desea comprar telas, pinturas, pinceles, agujas, hilos y demás insumos. Agradece por la oportunidad de progreso que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Ka'apoty" was formed through the initiative of one of the women, who approached the office of the Fundación to learn more about the Enterprising Women Program.  Now this group is in its first loan cycle, with 16 members.  This communal bank has demonstrated unity and solidarity amongst the members, who have their own businesses and are very hardworking.

Mirian is one of the  members of this group, and she tells us that through the crafts that she makes she has been able to get ahead with her family.  She is a very ingenious and creative woman, who, because of her talents, has managed to make very good crafts that sell very well.

Mirian is requesting the help of the Fundación and Kiva so that she can continue with her work, and so that she can keep working in this field.  She wants to buy fabric, paint, brushes, needles, thread and other supplies.  She is grateful that she is receiving this opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paint, brushes, needles, thread and other supplies

loans.name: Roxana Marisol

texts.es:
Roxana, debido a que quiere mejorar sus ingresos, solicita otro préstamo para seguir con su negocio ya que cada día necesita comprar  productos frescos para hacer mas rentable el negocio; ella comprara mercadería como: pescado, conchas, camarones, teniendo variedad podrá vender más y los ingresos serán mejores para ella.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque mejoro en su negocio y en más clientes, las circunstancias mejoraron en su familia.
texts.en:
Because Roxana wants to improve her income, she applies for another loan to continue with her business. She needs indeed to buy every day fresh products to make her business more profitable. She will buy goods such as fish, shellfish and shrimps; a greater variety will boost her sales and she will have more income.

Her previous loans helped her because they enabled her to improve her business and attract more customers, and this circumstance improved the situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish and shrimps.

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Niveen, 29 years old, is a married lady, and she has two daughters and a son. 

After she got her bachelor's degree, Niveen started working at one of the Jordanian universities as the head of library department. She also registered in the university to get a master's degree in Arabic language.

Now Niveen has applied for a loan to pay for her master's semester fees, so she can continue and get a doctorate in the same major, then work as a teacher in the university.

loans.use: to pay for her master's semester fees.

loans.name: Alma Muriel

texts.es:
Alma, necesita invertir en su negocio, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para su negocio y comprar la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de tortillas como: maíz, leña, gas, bolsas plásticas, de esa forma podrá siempre mantener la clientela y las ganancias serán mejores cada dia.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque realizo la inversion en materiales para su negocio tanto de pupusas como de hacer tortillas, ademas resolvio problemas de salud de sus hijos. Actualmente su familia esta estable.
texts.en:
Alma needs to invest in her business, so she is requesting a new business loan to buy the ingredients needed to make tortillas, such as corn, firewood, gas and plastic bags.  In this way, she will always be able to retain her customers, and her earnings will grow each day.  

Her previous loans helped her, because she was able to invest in supplies for her business, which involves making pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran snack) as well as tortillas.  In addition, she was able to resolve some health problems that her children had.  Now her family's situation is stable.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, gas and plastic bags

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is married and has four children. Augustine is a peddler; she sells ladies wear, shoes, children’s wear,  underwear and soap in Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for five years. 

Augustine uses her income to support her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Augustine will use the loan to purchase ladies wear, children’s wear and underwear for sale. With the new profits from her business, Augustine plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ladies wear, children’s wear and underwear for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of gari (fermented cassava) and beans to cook for sale.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a married woman. She has two children, twins at age of ten years. She describes herself to be patient, caring and determined. She operates a grocery store, where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a busy populated area, and her primary customers are residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Lillian's business goal is to venture into a retail shop within the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha sells cloth, sponges, towels and cosmetics in Asebu Ekroful. Agatha completed form 4. She is single and has three children. 

Agatha has been selling the above for 12 years now. She is responsible for feeding and clothing her children. Her loan will be used to purchase cloth, sponges, towels and cosmetics for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount up a shop to contain her goods.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sponges, towels and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Fredy Fernando

texts.es: Dedicación es la mejor palabra con la que se puede identificar a Fredy Fernando, pues a sus 29 años de edad maneja un negocio de cultivo de frutas desde hace 10 años y gracias al cual genera los ingresos necesarios para sostener los gastos del hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años. Fredy Fernando ha pasado por grandes dificultades en su vida y aspira a que su hijo no tenga que sufrir las mismas circunstancias, por esto Fredy Fernando trabaja todos los días fuertemente para que su hijo tenga un futuro económico estable y pueda obtener la mejor educación posible. Gracias al buen trabajo de Fredy Fernando su negocio ha tenido grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, por lo que tuvo que acudir a contratar mayor cantidad de trabajadores para responder a los pedidos realizados por sus clientes. Como sus clientes le pagan unos meses después de contratar el pedido, Fredy Fernando esta en busca de un préstamo que le permita pagar la mano de obra contratada y comprar insumos que requiere su cultivo como abono, insecticidas y fungicidas. Fredy Fernando aspira que con su préstamo pueda pagar estos gastos sin tener que esperar a que sus clientes le hagan efectivo el pago y así no tener que frenar el ritmo de producción que actualmente tiene su negocio. Fredy Fernando manifiesta que si su negocio sigue con el ritmo de producción actual, podrá incrementar considerablemente sus ingresos y así podrá cumplir sus grandes sueños que son brindarle la mayor calidad de vida posible a su hijo y su esposa y comprar el terreno en el cual cultiva sus frutas y así no generar tantos egresos por el arrendamiento.
texts.en: Dedication is the best word to use to identify Fredy Fernando.  At 29 years old, he has managed a business of fruit cultivation for ten years.  Thanks to the business he generates the necessary income to pay for the household expenditures in which he lives with his wife and his four-year-old son.  He has experienced great difficulties in his life and he aspires for his son not to suffer the same circumstances.  This is why he works hard everyday so that his son will have a stable economic future and can obtain the best education possible.  Thanks to his good work, his business has had large orders placed by his customers therefore he has had to hire more workers to meet the large orders placed by his customers.  Since his customers pay him some months after placing the orders, he is looking for a loan that will allow him to pay for the labor contracted and to buy inputs required such as fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides.  He aspires that with his loan he can pay these expenses without having to wait for his customers to make their payments and in this way not have to stop the current rhythm of production of his business.  He says that if his business continues with the current rhythm of production, he will be able to increase considerably his income and in this way fulfill his big dreams of giving the best quality of life to his son and his wife and buy land to cultivate his fruits and in that way not generate so many expenses from the lease.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides, fungicides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and seed.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam, a 40-year-old housewife, has six sons and daughters. 

Her oldest son, Akram, 19 years old, works at a restaurant and at the same time studies at the university to work in medical labs. 

Because Akram is the oldest, Khitam wanted to help him so he can graduate and be an effective person in the society and also help the family. She has applied for a loan in order to pay for his semester fees.

Because Khitam is a conservative person, she asked her son, Akram, to be in the photo instead.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Nhon's Group

texts.en:
Nhon is 33 years old and has two children who are school age. 

She manages a small wood workshop that makes furniture. Her business started five years ago. It creates a stable income for her. 

Participating in our credit program in 2010, she expanded her production scale. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong (VND) to buy wood for furniture.

Nhung is 27 years old. She raises pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 VND to buy food for them.

Thao is 24 years old. She is a furniture maker. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy tools.

Tinh is 37 years old. She is a businesswoman. She sells everything that can bring a profit. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND as capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more firewood for the production of her charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: El señor Faustino es un cliente que viene por recomendación de su hermano que es cliente de la institución, el se dedica a la producción de ladrillos en la zona de Bajo Alpacoma, la venta la realiza en la misma fabrica como también lo lleva a la obra, el señor cuenta con un camión con el cual lleva a la obra los ladrillos que los vende, tiene 6 hijos mayores y pequeños los hijos mayores junto a su esposa le ayudan en la producción de ladrillos, como pudimos ver en la visita la familia es muy humilde pero muy trabajadora, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de material para la fabricación de ladrillos	 ya que por estas épocas de lluvia suben de precio, y el desea fabricar por cantidad, el Sr. Faustino es muy trabajador se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Faustino is a customer who comes on the recommendation from his brother who is a customer of the institution. He works in the production of bricks in the Bajo Alpacoma zone. The sale is done at the same factory since he also takes it to the job site. He has a truck, which he uses to take the bricks that he sells to the job site. He has six adult and little children. The adult children, together with his wife, help him in the production of bricks. As we saw in the visit, the family is very humble but very hard working. The loan, which he is requesting, is to buy material for the manufacture of bricks since in these rainy seasons, the price increases and he would like to produce by quantity. Faustino is a hard worker, he is very grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy material to produce more bricks before the rains.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария – замужем, у нее взрослая дочь. Мария живет и работает в городе Ивано-Франковске. В свое время она работала на радиозаводе. После закрытия завода Мария была вынуждена пойти на базар и начать собственный бизнес. Сейчас она занимается розничной торговлей женской обувью на центральном рынке своего родного города, где всегда много потенциальных покупателей. В этой сфере работает уже 12 лет. Чистая прибыль на данный момент составляет 5 000 гривен. 

Мария планирует вложить кредит от КИВА в размере 17 000 гривен в закупку ассортимента зимней обуви, а именно она хотела бы приобрести 65 пар обуви для последующей реализации у себя. Пока еще зимняя обувь пользуется спросом, Мария надеется за счет хорошей	выручки увеличить и свой доход. Марии нравится работать с этим видом товара,  и, хотя она торговала самыми разными вещами раньше, сейчас она решила заниматься исключительно реализацией женской обуви. В этом ей помогает и дочь, которая работает на том же рынке, реализуя аналогичный товар на своей торговой точке. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Mariya is married and has a grown daughter. Mariya lives and works in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk. At one time she worked at a radio factory. After the closure of the factory Mariya was forced to go to the market and start her own business. She is now engaged in retailing women's shoes at the central market of her native city where there is always a lot of potential buyers. She has been working in this field for twelve years. Her net income at the moment is 5,000 hryvna.

Mariya plans to invest the loan from Kiva in the amount of 17,000 hryvna to buy a range of winter shoes, precisely she wants to buy 65 pairs of shoes for the resale. Winter shoes are still in demand and Mariya hopes to increase her income from good sales. Mariya enjoys working with this type of product, and while she used to sell a variety of other things before, now she has decided to deal exclusively with selling of women's shoes. Her daughter helps her in this business who works on the same market by selling a similar product at her point of sale.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of winter shoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has six children. 

She operates a chop bar (where African dishes are prepared for sale) and she also sells fried fish at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for 20 years. Her husband is a driver. Mary uses her income to help her husband. 

Mary will use the loan to purchase cassava for the fufu (made from pounded, glutenized cassava), maize for banku (starchy maize dumplings) and other ingredients for the preparation of the food to sell. 

With the new profits from her business, Mary plans to get a better place to serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cassava for the fufu, maize for the banku and other ingredients for the preparation of the food to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells plastic bowls, bananas and popcorn at Asebu Ekroful. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader.

Victoria has been selling plastic products, bananas and popcorn for four years. She assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees with her income. Victoria will use her loan to purchase plastic bowls, bananas and popcorn for sale.  

She hopes to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, plastic bowls, and popcorn for resale

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 30 years old and has two children who are school age.  

She manages a wood workshop that makes furniture. Her business started  seven years ago and it brings good revenue for her family. 

Participating in our credit program in 2008, she used her loan effectively in expanding her production scale.  

Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy wood as material.

loans.use: to buy wood as material for furniture making.

loans.name: Farihan

texts.en:
Farihan, a 19-year-old single lady, is the only girl in a family with five boys.

Farihan is a civil engineering student in one of the Jordanian universities. She has applied for a loan so she can pay for her semester's fees to get her bachelor's degree. Then she will work in the field while continuing to get a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her semester's fees.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. He describes himself as determined, patient and innovative. 

He provides transport services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a busy and strategic place and his primary customers are town people. He describes his biggest business challenge as delayed payment from customers. His business goal is to run a car rental company within five years. 

He also gets additional income from his spouse's beauty salon. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products for his spouse's salon.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for his spouse's beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava for her gari production and fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, the mother of two children and the wife of a driver, has been selling banku in Asebu Ekroful for four years. Rebecca, who uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills, is requesting this loan to purchase maize in bulk to cook banku to sell. With the new profits from her business, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk to cook banku for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  is married and has two children.  Mary sells "kenkey" (fermented maize dough) at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for 40 years. Her husband is a charcoal seller.
