loans.use: to purchase 3/8 iron, cement, bricks, boards, gravel and manual labor.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is forty-eight years of age and is married with nine children.

Luisa owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has five years of experience in this business.    Luisa needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Luisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Luisa's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Samoa

texts.en:
Samoa is thirty one years of age and is married with no children.

Samoa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business.  Samoa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Samoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Samoa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase roof beams, cement and labor costs.

loans.name: Laumata

texts.en:
Laumata is 23 years of age.  She is married and has no children.

Laumata owns and operates a business venture, selling dried goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Laumata needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional utensils such as frying pan, an oven, and storage cotainers.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Laumata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Laumata's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase addititonal utensils such as frying pan, an oven, storage containers

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El señor  Adolfo es una persona  trabajadora y responsable actualmente  tiene  ya  doce  años laborando en su actual trabajo, el proyecto  que   desea  realizar   es  comprar  un portón para  su  vivienda es  por  ello  que  acudió a la institución  para   que  la apoyemos  en la realización de  este, agradece  el apoyo   brindado  ya que    su domicilio  estará   protegido y podrá  brindar a  su  familia   una  mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Mr.  Adolfo is a hardworking and responsible person. Currently he has been working at his present job for twelve years. The project he is hoping to realize is to purchase a front door for his living quarters. Thus he turned to the institution so that we may support him in carrying out this project. 

He appreciates the support provided since his residence will be protected and he will be able to provide better security for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a front door for his living quarters.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora  Margarita es una persona  muy trabajadora  la cual actualmente  tiene un negocio de abarrotes,  esta le  ha  permitido  salir  adelante  día  con día, en esta  ocasión requiere  de nuestra ayuda para realizar  su  proyecto  el cual consiste  en  comprar mercancía para   vender, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado   ya  que  le  permitirá  aumentar sus   ventas   generando  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Margarita is a very hardworking person who currently has a grocery store business which has allowed her to get ahead day by day. On this occasion she needs our help with a project which consists of purchasing merchandise to sell. 

She appreciates the support provided since it will allow her to increase her sales and generate greater income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: El señor  Eloy    es una persona muy trabajadora  y  responsable  que  día   con día se  esfuerza  por  salir adelante , en  esta  ocasión  el se  acerco  a la institución  ya  que  desea terminar de construir el  cuarto  de  lavado   que  actualmente  tiene  en su  vivienda ya  que  debido a  la  temporada  de  frío su  esposa   se enfermo  en  varias  ocasiones  ya  que  tenia  que  salir  al patio   a  lavar, agradece  el apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto   ya  que  brindara  a  su    esposa   una mayor  comodidad al  realizar  las  labores  del  hogar.
texts.en: Eloy is a hardworking and responsible person that day by day strive to succeed. On this occasion he is approaching the institution as he desires to finish building the laundry room that he currently has at home. Due to the cold season his wife has gotten sick on various occasions since she had to go out to the patio to do the wash. He is thankful for the support provided by the realization of his project as it will provide his wife a better accommodation to do the household chores.

loans.use: to construct a room at home.

loans.name: Raudel

texts.es: El señor  Raudel es una persona responsable   que  a lo largo  de los años  se  ha  esforzado por  acondicionar  su  vivienda,   el se  acerco  con  nosotros  por  que  requiere   pintar  su   domicilio  ya  que   la pintura  con la  que  cuenta actualmente  esta   deteriorada,  ve  en el  crédito la  posibilidad  de  que  su  vivienda   tenga  una mejor   imagen, agradece  el  apoyo brindado  para  la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Raudel is a responsible person that over the years has strived to improve his home. He approached us because he needs to paint his home, as the paint that exits today is deteriorated. He saw in the credit, the possibility of his housing having a better image. He is thankful for the support provided for the realization of his project.

loans.use: to purchase paint.

loans.name: Maria Alma  Delia

texts.es: La señora Alma  es  una persona responsable la cual se  dedica  a la venta  de  calzado  por  catalogo   lo cual le  a permitido  salir  adelante  día  con  día   y brindarle  a su  familia  una estabilidad  económica,  ella  se  acerco  con nosotros  ya que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de   zapatos  para  seguir brindado  a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio que  la  a  caracterizado, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en: Alma is a responsible person who sells footwear by catalog for a living, which has allowed her to progress day by day and provide her family economic stability. She approached us as she need to make the purchase of shoes in order to continue providing to her clients the excellent service which they characterize to her. She is thankful for the support in order to realize her project.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has two children.  She is 44 years old and resides at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lilian owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  She has been in this business for ten years.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

In 2008, Lilian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  In the future, Lilian wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Sa Moun

texts.en:
Sa Moun is 36 years old and married.  She resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (such as the ancient temples of Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey). 

Sa Moun has been involved in growing rice for over six years and is successful in her career.  Additionally, she is a basket weaver.  Her husband is an APSARA authority who is responsible for looking after Angkorian sites.  One of her children is employed at a restaurant.  

Due to her daughter's difficult commute to work, Sa Moun is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter.  With a motorbike, her daughter will be able to get to work on time easily and save some money on her transportation expenses in order to support her family better.  In the future, Sa Moun would like to build a new house and support her children to study until they get married.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work.

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
Soum is 54 years old and widowed.  She resides with one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (such as the ancient temples of Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey). 

Soum has been involved in growing a variety of vegetables to sell at the market to generate income. Her child is employed in a hotel. In order to improve her family's livelihood, Soum is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season. By doing so, her family's economic situation will be improved. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh is 52 years old and married.  She resides with her husband and six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (such as the ancient temples of Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey). 

Vinh has been a basket weaver for over five years. Her husband has been involved in breeding cattle to sell for a profitable price for over three years and is successful in his career. Two of her children are employed as construction workers. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Vinh is requesting a loan of US $900 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like renovate her house and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Chom

texts.en:
Chom is 39 years old and a resident of the Baray district. She has been blessed with 5 children, all of whom are single and unemployed and live together in a house with their parents. 

Chom runs a small business at home, raising piglets in a wooden pigpen built by her husband. Her husband is in the business of selling firewood from his trailer. Chom is able to generate less income than her husband, earning approximately $1.50 per day. Due to the lack of animals for hauling a firewood trailer, Chom’s husband won’t be able to operate the business well. So now Chom is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a buffalo, which can be used to haul the trailer, to support in her husband’s business. In the future, Chom hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo , which can be used to haul the trailer, to support in her husband’s business.

loans.name: Phean

texts.en:
Phean is 47 years old and married.  She resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

Phean and her husband are construction workers.  All of her children are employed: two are garment workers and one is a construction worker.  Due to the difficulty of traveling to work, Phean is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.  By doing so, she will more easily get to work and save some money from her transportation expenses to better support the family.  In the future, she would like to expand her business to be a construction foreman and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Sergio is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol.  He is married and has five children between the ages of 2 and 14 years.

Sergio has been growing and selling rice for five years.  He tills his own land and makes sure his crops grow healthy.  Sergio earns about PHP 5000 per month doing this farming.  He has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.  Sergio hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Joreynelle

texts.en: Joreynelle is 28 years old, single and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by growing rice and earns about PHP 8,000 a month. She joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 14,062 to buy supplies for her farm, such as fertilizer and seeds. This will be Joreynelle's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm.

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary manages a large crop of rice in the Philippines. He has been in this business for almost 30 years. With his long duration in farming, Hilary state that his expert in managing his rice field is continually improved. He is also continuously dream that he will maintain good quality of crops and get high yield.
Hilary is 52 years of age, married, and is blessed with nine children. Hilary’s wife is a teacher and work also as a housekeeper. The reason why Hilary always dreams to get high yield is to further bestow his children needs in school which are mostly sending in college.
With the costly farm inputs at this time, Hilary gets financial shortage to sustain his farm needs. Hilary is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides for his farm. He believes that through this loan, he will provide all farm inputs needed in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 37-year-old married woman with two children, ages 19 and 10. Her husband works as a farmer.

Vicenta runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various items like vinegar, soy sauce, soft drinks, and canned goods. Vicenta earns 3,000 PHP per month with her business. She is able to help provide for her family's daily needs.

Vicenta has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soft drinks, and rice. She hopes this loan will help her business grow more.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soft drinks, and rice.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So is 39 years old and a security guard who works for a private company in Phnom Penh City. She works eight hours per day and has only a day off within a week. She lives in Dongkor district with her husband, a construction worker, and three children. 

Currently Mrs. So has saved some money because she wants to build a fence around her house. However, her funds are insufficient for this. Therefore, she would like to seek a loan from HKL to add to her existing capital so she can build a fence in order to protect her home. 

In the future, Mrs. So hopes to own a construction supplies store. She will try to work hard to provide her children with further education.

loans.use: to add to her existing capital to build a fence in order to protect her home.

loans.name: Ruvie Ann

texts.en:
Ruvie Ann is a widow at the early age of 32 years old. She lives in Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines with her one child.

Ruvie Ann manages a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years. Every month she earns 7,000 PHP from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 15,500 PHP to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories. In 2009, Ruvie Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ruvie Ann hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 53 years old and lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her husband and four children. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by providing transportation (or habal-habal) services by using a vehicle that carries two to six passengers. In 2010, Melinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 PHP to repair her vehicle so that she can provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Chanh

texts.en:
Mr. Chanh is 52 years old with 2 children who are grown up.  He is managing a grocery shop which started many years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2003, Mr. Chanh is alway a cluster leader and used loans effectively in expanding his sales.

Currently, he wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more kinds of products to meet the demands of customers on the Tet (Vietnamese New Year) holiday.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of products to meet the demands of customers.

loans.name: Sokmarn

texts.en:
Sokmarn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two school-age children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are construction workers.

Sokman is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase construction materials for repairing her house. By doing so, she would have a comfortable house to live in. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is single, 29 years old and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Roy is operating a service-based business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been 5 years in this business. Each month he earns 5,600 doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories.  In 2008, Roy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. In the future, Roy wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Ms. Bich is 37 years old with 2 children who are attending secondary school. Bich is an elementary nurse. After working hours, Bich creates extra money buy raising pigs for meat.

Joining in our credit program in 2004, she has used loans effectively in raising pigs. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
Because the group was successful during the last loan period and the price for piglets now is increasing, the Sumbersari Permai group decided to continue and ask for a higher loan. Now they get 15M IDR and per member they get 1,5M IDR. 

Ni Kadek, as the head of the group, will use her loan to purchase four more piglets. She will cover the feed out of her own money. She’s very confident to run the business because of the good market now for the fattening. She hopes the cooperation between MUK and the group will last until all the members can run their businesses by themselves.

loans.use: To purchase four more piglets.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a humble person with a strong personality. Even so, he’s cheerful and very hardworking. He lives with his wife and three children in Villa Concepcion, province of Isabela.

Arthur works raising pigs, a business he started one year ago. He started raising pigs and as they grew he’d sell them.Now, he needs to increase his business and this is why he’s taking out this loan that he will use to buy hog feed, vaccine, vitamins and additional hog to raise. This business helps Arthur because it’s the only source of income he has to raise his family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vaccine, vitamins and additional hog to raise

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie is married with 2 children. Ritchie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Ritchie has a retail business. She has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns approximately 4,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Ritchie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Yav

texts.en:
Miss Yav, 23 years old, is living with her single mother, 56, in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. Yav runs a pig-fattening business for her livelihood. At the same time, she also acts as a seamstress from her home to generate additional income. She is able to make revenue in the neighborhood of $5.00 per day from these activities. 

On behalf of the family, Yav has to try to work hard to support their living, especially her mother, whose work is to manage household things at home. For her first loan from Kiva, Yav would like to purchase a motorcycle for the use of the whole family.

In the future, Yav plans to fix some broken parts of her house to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the use of the whole family.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is from Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 25 years old and single. 

To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and drinks in the local community. Michelle has been in her business for 3 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Michelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 12,575 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is from Mabini Extension Ozamiz City. He is 25 years old. Rogelio is now married and he has one child. 

To make a living, Rogelio owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing watch and cell-phone repair services to local community members. Rogelio has been in his business for 4 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials he needs to expand the services he offers in his watch and cell-phone repair business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials he needs to expand the services he offers in his watch and cell-phone repair business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Cristina has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. Cristina has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase dried fish to sell to customers of her dried fish stall.

Cristina has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she would like to have a number of dried fish stalls in the locality.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell to customers of her dried fish stall.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita’s neighbor admires her for being humble. She is a housekeeper at the same time managing their rice field. Estelita is 52 years old and blessed with three children. Her husband is a chairman in their village and her partner in managing their farm.
Estelita has been in this type of business for over thirty years. Through their profits in farming, Estelita was able to send her children in school. She and her husband will continue to manage their rice farming business. They will strive to continue support their children needs in school and will have a better future. 
Estelita is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care. She hopes to become a successful farmer a borrower as well.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care.

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Уже девять лет как она занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Barno lives in the A. Jomi region. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is currently in Russia. Barno has secondary eduation. She has been raising cattle for nine years. She is taking the loan to purchase calves and increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy calves for her herd

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Ms Ky is 53 years old with 2 children  who are grown. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raising chickens. Joining in our credit program in 2007, she used loan for raising. For new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnam dong to  reconstruct her house  to have good housing condition.

loans.use: to  re construct  her house for good housing condition

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov, 31, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Pov is requesting for a loan of USD 800 to purchase dirt to fill up her village land in order to build a new house. In the future, she would like to support her child to study until he/she gets a Bachelors degree.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up her village land in order to build a new house

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.ru: Зебогул замужем. Ей 46 лет. У нее семеро детей. Ее муж вместе с сыновьями работает в Российской Федерации. Сама Зебогул имеет среднее образование. Она занимается скотоводством. В этой области она уже тринадцать лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота с целью увеличения их количества.
texts.en: Zebogul is 46 years old, married, and has seven children. Her husband and sons work away from home in the Russian Federation. Zebogul herself has a secondary education. She has been involved in animal husbandry for thirteen years. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle so she can increase their quantity.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 42 years old business woman whose husband is a retired military officer. They are blessed with six children of ages between three to 23 years of age.

She has been a distributor of household goods for two years and the business earns her a basic monthly income of Kshs 3,000. She requires a loan of Kshs 5,000 that she would use to buy more merchandise to boost her business. 

Hellen’s hopes and dreams are to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To  buy more merchandise goods for sale to boost her home products business.

loans.name: Proeun

texts.en: Mrs. Proeun, 32, is a married woman who is in the business of pig raising business. She has been in this business for more than 2 years. She typically earns an average of $4.00 per day to cover her daily needs. And presently she has been blessed with 2 school-age children attending in a local public primary school. Proeun wants to improve her business: buys additional piglets to raise, build a healthy pigpen for her pigs and purchase pig feeds. However, she has inadequate capital to attain her goal. Therefore, she is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to support in her pig fattening business. She hopes that her business will improve and thereby increase her household revenue.

loans.use: to support in her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is 37 years old a business lady, she is a single mother of one child. She has been making clothes for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses to support her child.

She is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Felista will use the loan to buy cloth materials for her stock.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth materials for her stock.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 39-year-old mixed crop farmer. She is married to Pharis, who is a businessman. They are blessed with one child, who is nine years old. She has been in the farming business for the past year and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Esther will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Mr. Hiep is 39 years old and has two children. He is a tailor and is managing a tailor shop. His business started many years ago. His shop is always busy with customers. Joining our credit program in 2006, he used loans to buy a sewing machine and fabric. Currently, he wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy fabric to meet the increasing demand of customers for the Tet holiday (Vietnamese new year).

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Bebialen

texts.en:
Bebialen is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 23 years old. Bebialen is now married and has one child. 

To make a living, Bebialen makes and sells barbecue in the market. Bebialen has been in her business for four years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Bebialen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. Bebialen is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make barbecue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and a farmer; she is married to Patrick who is a business man. They are blessed with two children aged 15 and 10 years respectively. She has been rearing poultry for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Irene will use the loan to buy chicken feed and more chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and more chicks

loans.name: La Fuente 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Clautide is the coordinator of the Group La Fuente (The Fountain) 1, 2 & 3. The members live in the slums located to the north of Santo Domingo. This group is located in one of the poorest community to the north of Santo Domingo. Clautide sells fruits and vegetables. This is the first loan she has requested from Esperanza, and she is planning to purchase oranges, bananas, pinneaples, papayas, and other fruits and vegetables. She is very excited about this loan, which made it possible to reinvest in her business and expand her sales into more products and clients.

Clautide tells us that her challenges has been to start her business, going forward and to raise her children. She is a single mother of two children, and they live together with her.  Her business profits will be used to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support. 

In this loan, we are adding three pictures, they were taken in their community. The three pictures complete the group of 15 members.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Ms Hong is 33 years old with 3 children who are at school age. She is running a small shop that sells fresh vegetables in a local market. Her business started many years  ago and  it creates stable income for her to manage family life. Participating in our credit program in 2003, she used loans in farming activity and selling. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnam dong to buy vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is engaged to transportation business using his jeepney. He has been in this business for two years and he is thankful because he usually receives PHP 5,000 every week. Right now, Rodrigo is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase wheels, oil, and gasoline for the maintenance of his jeepney. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wheels, oil, and gasoline for the maintenance of his jeepney

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en: Ms Tuyen is 31 years old with 2 children who are at Primary school. Being a farmer,she grows rice and raises chickens. This activities started for long times. Participating in our program in 2005, she has used loans effectively in expanding her cultivation  and raising. For new loan cycle, she  requires  a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for chickens

loans.use: to buy food for chickens

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 35 years old, married with three children aged 1, 3 and 7. She sells shoes to earn a living, she has been in the business for 8 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Ms Phuong is 45 years old with 1 daughter who is at High school.  Being a farmer, she grows rice, vegetables and raises pigs for meat. This business has run many years. Participating in our credit program in 2010, she used loans to expand her farming activities and always in good repayment situation. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
To earn living, Brenda raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pig for sale. She decided to establish her business to generate income instead of just lazing at home and doing household chores. She is 40 years old and is married with six children. 

She would like to expand her business, but she has insufficient funds, therefore she is asking a loan PHP20,000 to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of her hogs. She hopes this loan will be granted as it is her only chance to improve her business and her family's lives as well.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom, 35, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction worker. Selling groceries is the main source of income in the family. In order to improve her family economy, Sarom is requesting for a loan of USD 250 to purchase more groceries to sell at home to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, renew her house and support her child to study until he/she gets Bachelor degree

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at home

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 39 years old a farmer; she is married to Pharis who is a business man. They are blessed with one child aged nine years. She has been rearing poultry for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for his first loan term from  KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Alice will use the loan to buy chicken feeds and more chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and more chicks

loans.name: Ashirgul

texts.ru: Аширгуль родилась на юге страны, в селе Красный Октябрь и выросла в большой семье простых рабочих.  После окончания школы она помогала семье по хозяйству, о дальнейшем получении образования в то время не могло быть и речи. Основным источником дохода семьи было выращивание риса, работа с домашней живностью и полеводством. Выйдя замуж за своего односельчанина, молодая семья трудится на поле, так же выращивая рис. С тех пор прошло 28 лет, через многие трудности прошла семья. Жить в родном селе становилось все трудней и трудней, земли не хватало для всех, а у Аширгуль с мужем к тому времени подрастали 8 детей. В 2000 году семья решается переехать в Чуйскую долину (северная часть). На накопленные средства семья покупает небольшой домик, четверо сыновей помогают отцу заниматься земледелием, сама Аширгуль возделывает земельный участок с овощами, собранный урожай продают на рынке. Благодаря доходам от полеводства, в конце 2000 года семья смогла купить себе корову. На сегодняшний день, Аширгуль и ее семья обрабатывают 8,5га арендованной земли, где выращивают лук и другие овощи, в хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аширгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры и  минеральных удобрений, так как зимой данное сырье дешевле и в сезон посевных работ резко вырастает в цене. В будущем, Аширгуль мечтает открыть свою мини- ферму.
texts.en:
Ashirgul was born in the south of the country, in the village of Red October, and grew up in a large family of ordinary workers. After finishing school, she helped her family on the farm, as there could be no talk of further education at that time. The main source of income for the family was growing of rice, work with livestock and field crop cultivation. 

Marrying a fellow villager, the young family was working in the field, growing rice as well. 28 years old went by, and the family went through many difficulties. It became harder and harder to live in the native village, the land was not enough for everyone, and Ashirgul and her husband were by this time raising eight children. 

In 2000, the family decided to move to the Chuy valley (northern part). From their accumulated funds, the family bought a small house. The four sons helped the father with farming. Ashirgul grew vegetables on a plot of land, and sold the harvest at the market. Thanks to the income from the field crop cultivation, the family was able to buy a cow at the end of 2000. At present, Ashirgul and her family work 8.5 hectares of rented land, where they grow onions and other vegetables, and the farm has two dairy cows. 

With an aim to further expand her business, Ashirgul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of fertilizers, because this raw material is cheaper in winter, and in the plating season the price rises sharply. In the future Ashirgul dreams of opening her own mini-farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock for wheat flour and sugar for her hotel

loans.name: Geoffery

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 43 years old a mixed crop farmer, he is married to Winnie who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from  KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Geoffrey will use the loan to buy seedling and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 55 years old and been in the farming business for 12 years now. He had been patiently planting and harvesting rice to sell as the source of his income. He had one child attending to high school. 

He is asking for a loan to have an additional capital in buying seeds, fertilizer and insecticide use in farming. He asks for P17,000 for crop maintenance.

With all his efforts, he hopes to educate his children up to college so that he will become successful to his chosen career. If this will happen, Ricardo will be very happy and proud.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide use in farming

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is a farmer who lives at Capatan. He is married with four children sending to school. He needs to increase his profits due to cost of basic commodities and school expenses now a days is increasing too. He is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy vitamins, medicines and hog feed for sustainability.

He would like to ensure good nutrition of his hogs so that he can offer it at a higher cost when hogs are ready for disposal. Someday he hopes to make the business grow into a piggery and keep improving sales for additional profits and help finance the college education of his children.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, medicines and hog feed for sustainanbility

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 32 years old a business lady, she is married to Francis who is a business man. They are blessed with one child aged five years. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Susan will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a whole sale shop which will help improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy skirts, trousers and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 40-year-old business woman who owns a posho mill. She is married to Ezra, who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children, ages 20, 17, 14, 11, six and two.

She has worked in her posho mill for one year and earns a monthly income of  21,590 KES. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD to buy more maize to stock in her business. 

The profit she gets would help her buy more maize. Her dreams are to build rental houses and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en: Branka is in her late 40s, married and has three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling clothes. She works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. and earns a good income. She is applying for her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and plans to use it to buy more clothing to sell. Her goal is to make enough money to build her own house. Branka will share this loan with the 16 members of her loan group, which is called Saranga. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mellisah

texts.en: Mellisah is 27 years old, married and has three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling food. She is doing well because there is little competition. She joined Faulu Kenya to expand her business and become more financially stable. She is applying for a loan for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes to make chips to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to use to make chips.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 40 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past two years, she has owned a general store and she earns 5,000 PHP from her business. Marichu has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Marichu is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase more stock for her store. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 42 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental Philippines. For the past four years, she has operated a transportation business in her local community. Emelyn earns approximately 20,000 PHP from her work. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. 

Emelyn is requesting a 34,633 PHP loan to purchase a motorcycle to provide better service. In the future, she hopes to finish her college studies and double the income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcyle
